With the loan, there is a greater possibility that the foliage of his crop will remain in good condition, and he will fulfill the need to be able to fertilize his fruit tree plantation.

José's dream and that of his family is to have everything necessary to cultivate and fertilize his crops, and in the future to have to opportunity to buy some more things that are necessary for his home. He wants his daughter to have a better life and to send her to school. He intends to let her study until she becomes a professional; that is his vision.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer, foliar spray and labor for weeding

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 28 años es una madre ejemplar. Vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su esposo e hijo al que cuida con mucho amor. El trabajo al que se dedica desde hace 5 años es la siembra de papa, alverja y demás alimentos. Cuenta que desde que conformó su familia comenzó a sembrar por su propia cuenta, de eso ya algunos años, gracias a sus padres ahora tiene sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Espera dentro de algunos meses poder mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos pues hace poco adquirió unos terrenos propios para aumentar la cantidad de sus cosechas, ahora tiene pensado ahorrar para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Francisca, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 28 years old and is an exemplary mother. She lives in her parents' house together with her husband and her son, whom she cares for with a lot of love. For the last five years, she has made a living by planting potatoes, peas and other foods.

She says that she started to plant things on her own when she started a family a few years ago. Thanks to her parents she now has agricultural lands of her own. She hopes to be able to improve the quality of her crops within a few months, as she recently acquired some lands of her own in order to increase the quantity of her crops. At the moment she intends to save to improve the quality of her crops.

This is her first loan with Kiva. Over time she has shown herself to be a responsible person who is committed to her association. She therefore commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. Francisca will invest the 600 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hafizan

texts.en: Hafizan is an energetic 48-year-old married woman. For the last 16 years, she has been been in the business of manufacturing ‘waan’ (which is a material used in bedding). She makes various kinds of waan in different colors, and is famous for providing a good-quality product to people in her community. This is how she meets the needs of her family members. Her husband works with his wife because his income is not enough to meet the needs of his family. Hafizan has seven children, one daughter and six sons, four of whom attend school. She would like to improve her business, so she has applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy another waan-making machine for her husband to use when helping her in his free time. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf, she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to use part of the money she earns for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy another waan-making machine.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy, de 34 años, es una valiente madre soltera, que cuida con mucho amor de su hija de 12 años. Con la que vive en casa de sus padres.Desde muy joven afronto muchas dificultades; pues tenía que hacer frente a las responsabilidades de ser mamá. Comenzando así desde hace 12 años a sembrar papa, alverja, habas y lechuga, en sus terrenos propios; que heredó de parte de sus padres. Todas las mañanas comparte sus actividades, ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, criando a los carneros, cerdos y vacas, que posee. Alimentándolos hasta que estén ensebados, para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Asimismo prepara queso con la leche que produce las vacas, realizando de 2 a 4 moldes diarios, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 30 a S/.40 soles a la semana. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de maíz y lechuga, que dentro de un mes extraerá de la tierra. Asegurando su buena venta, pues trabajó mucho en su cuidado. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Susy, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Susy, 34, is a brave single mother that takes care of her 12 year-old daughter with much love.  From a young age she faced many difficulties because she had to confront the responsibilities of become a mom.  She started 12 years ago growing potatoes, peas, beans and lettuce on her own land that she inherited from her parents.  Every morning she divides her activities, as she works raising livestock like cattle, pork, and cows that she owns.  She feeds them until they are grown and she then sells them for a higher price.  She also makes cheese with the milk that the cows produce, she makes 2 to 4 containers every day, she earns 30 to 40 PEN per week.  She is now getting ready for corn and lettuce harvest, that she will get in a month. She will have a good sale, because she worked very hard caring for it.  This is her fifth loan with KIVA, during all this time she showed being a responsible and committed person with the association.  She promises to be punctual with the loan repayments.  Susy will invest 500 PEN in buying organic fertilizer for her land.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina ella es casada y tiene 63 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz y azúcar.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de pasamaneria, hospedaje, fotocopiadoras, cabinas de internet, cerrajero, restaurante, panaderia.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “LOS PERSEVERANTES” (The ones that persevere) communal bank, located in the district, province, and department of Cusco                                                                                                                                                                                            

Alejandrina is married and 63 years old. She alternates daily activities with the business of grocery store, where Alejandrina sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks among others. She has made a living from this business for a good time. A business, which is going well, thanks to the efforts that she puts each day into her business, the member wants to be able to continue to work for to support her family.

Alejandrina requested the loan to buy goods such as rice and sugar. The other members are engaged in the business of braids, lodging, photocopiers, internet booths, locksmith, restaurant, bakery.

The members of "Los Perseverantes" are in the attached photo asked for permission to arrive late in the meeting for work reasons. The person that comes up with a face covered does not belong to the village bank.

The member thanked all those who are part of this dream through Kiva and is committed to meet all the payments of in the timely manner.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 31 years old and an energetic married woman. For the last nine years, she has been doing a business of manufacturing "waan" (which is a material used in making charpoy, a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). 

She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous for providing good-quality waan in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. Rukhsana is the mother of four children: two daughters and two sons. Her husband is a laborer whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. 

She is running her own business confidently and supporting her family. Rukhsana has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy another waan-making machine for her son to assist her in his free time. 

She wants to expand her business to earn better profits to provide a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making "waan"

loans.name: Sanira

texts.en:
Sanira is a first-year student at AUCA's department of software engineering. Here is her story. 

“There is a time when every high school graduates have to decide what step to take on their education further. I did not have to think much, because I have been planning on going to American University of Central Asia since I was on 9th grade at my high school. I consider AUCA as the best university in my country and in the whole Central Asia, which gives a high qualified education. There were many departments to consider though. I wanted to choose any department related to math, because I am good at it. Basically I was thinking about two departments: Economics and Software Engineering. I stopped my choice on Software Engineering. I am sure that it will be interesting for me to study at the Software Engineering department and it will be able to make contribution for the benefit of our country. Another great opportunity that AUCA gives to all its students is a loan. Taking an opportunity I am also applying for a KIVA loan, which will help me to cover my tuition.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Loradel

texts.en:
Loradel is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 that she will use in growing her general store business by buying various groceries and food snacks that she will also sell in the school. Aside from this, Loradel has a livestock raising business as her other source of income. She hopes that her PHP 2,000 initial capital from retailing will get bigger and bigger to succeed someday. 

She is already 27 years old, got married when she was 23 and now has two school aged kids. Her husband works as a truck driver. They both work together towards fulfilling a progressive family life in their peaceful and pineapple rich village of Magleticia.

loans.use: in growing her general store business by buying various groceries and food snacks that she will also sell in the school.

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en:
Nabeela is 30 years old and married, the mother of two children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns a tailoring business, which is the only source of income for his family. He has excellent tailoring skills, and his customers appreciate his work. He is planning to purchase one more tailoring machine to cope with customers' needs efficiently and professionally. 

Nabeela, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase a machine to stitch up more dresses so he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Nabeela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine.

loans.name: 12 De Abril  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril está formado por 12 mujeres quienes laboran en la en un mercado de la ciudad, tienen un puesto en donde cada día es una nueva lucha para su superación, su objetivo en común es salir en adelante y brindarles a sus familias un futuro prometedor, aun conservan su cultura y tradiciones. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida como la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene clima frió y una belleza que enamora a quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Encarnación, es una socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias con quienes comparte diferentes actividades dentro de este grupo, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca.
La Señora Encarnación tiene 79 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos mayoría de edad, algunos ya son casados y viven independiente, sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.
Doña Encarnación se dedica a la venta de frutas y hortalizas en su propio local,  labora desde las 7 de la mañana sin un horario de salida ya que todo depende de las ventas del día. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y hortalizas para surtir su negocio. 
Su sueño es de conservar su salud y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
La foto pequeña es de tres socias que no pudieron estar prresentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'Sociedad 12 de Abril' [April 12th Association] loan group is formed by twelve women who work and have stalls in a city market where each day is a new struggle to overcome. Their common objective is to get ahead and to provide their families with a promising future, while still preserving their culture and traditions. The women live in the city of Cuenca, known as Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos. Since December 1999 it has been a World Heritage Site. It has a cold climate and a beauty that charms everyone who visits.

One of the members of this group is Encarnación. She is a founding member of the 'Sociedad 12 de Abril' loan group, and is very good friends with all of the group members, with whom she shares the responsibility for various group activities. She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca.

Encarnación is 79 years old. She has nine adult children from her marriage, some of whom are already married and live independently. Her unmarried children work and help her financially. She doesn't have a house of her own and rents her home. 

Encarnación makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables in her area. She works from 7 o'clock in the morning without a specific end time, as everything depends on the day's sales. She is going to invest the money from the loan in buying fruits and vegetables to stock her business. Her dream is to preserve her health and to keep growing in her business.

The small photo is of the three members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en: Shahida is a 33-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Shahida as a member of a two-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Samet is 48 years old and a rural villager residing in the Kos Krolo district of Battambang Province. He has four children, two of whom are students. To overcome the daily financial burden in the family, he has been farming rice, planting cassava, and growing corn for ten years. He and his wife are able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day from the current business.
Samet has not been with VisionFund in the past but he is now seeking an education loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, to pay for his son’s tuition fees for the faculty of General Management. He hopes that this loan will provide financial support for his son, so he can focus on his studies and obtain a good job after the graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Muqadas' Group

texts.en: Muqadas is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Muqadas, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Muqadas hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a tailoring business which is the only source of income for his family. He has excellent tailoring skills and his customers appreciate his work. He is planning to purchase one more tailoring machine to cope up with customers' needs efficiently and professionally. 

Abida, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase a machine to stitch up more dresses so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Abida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a tailoring business which is the only source of income for his family. He has excellent tailoring skills and his customers appreciate his work. He is planning to purchase one more tailoring machine to cope up with his customers' needs efficiently and professionally. Arshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a machine to stitch up more dresses so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Arshad hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to stitch up more dresses

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
"I dreamed of a progressive living and to see all my children supported sufficiently with their studies in the future" shared Perlita. Aged 29, she is the mother of two kids. Her husband is a farmer and has a motorcycle transport business for extra daily income. Her family lives in the village of Magleticia, a village rich in sweet pineapple fruits.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 as added capital for her retailing. She will use the loan to buy various grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, candies, bread, eggs, coffee and sugar. She will also buy sacks of hog feed to retail in their village as an added product offering. Perlita shared that her gross weekly income from retailing of PHP 4,000 was rolled into the business and some goes towards her children's school allowances in the grade school.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, candies, bread, eggs, coffee and sugar. She will also buy sacks of hog feed to retail in their village as an added product offering.

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Maricela, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  4 y de casi 3 años de edad. Su esposo es Economista y trabaja en una empresa. 
Doña Maricela se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Realiza sus recorridos todas las tardes ya que a esa hora su esposo ya está en la casa y puede cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. La mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque gracias a su primer crédito empezó su negocio. 
Su sueño es tener  un local donde vender.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro De la Mujer" communal bank meets in La Pila in Montecristi Canton every fortnight. This town is well-known in the province and the country for it's rich traditional culture. You can encounter a great variety of handicrafts here that are made by the local inhabitants, true to their traditional customs.

Maricela lives in this town. She is 27 years old, married and has two children from this relationship, aged 3 and 4. Her husband is an economist who works in a company. Maricela sells clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door but also sells from her home to her closest clients. She also fulfills customers requests. She goes out selling in the evenings when her husband is at home and can take care of the young children. She leaves her products on credit and collects every fortnight. Maricela goes to Guayaquil to buy the clothes when she needs to. She has done this business for 4 years and it is going well for her. 

Maricela will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years. She likes it, thanks to her first loan she could start her business. Her dream is to have a place to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 50, is the mother of seven children. She has a large family. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material for his work. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

His wife, Parveen, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. Parveen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 52-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling welding material nine years ago. 

Zarina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods so that he can respond quickly to his customers' needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Zarina hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: and her husband to purchase iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita's income from retailing is used for their family's immediate needs and the children's school fees, however, most of the time, her income is not enough so she wants her business to grow. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 that will be used to purchase various groceries such as seasonings, canned goods, coffee, sugar, eggs, drinks and more. 

She is 47 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are still studying. Her husband is a farmer. Together, her family lives happily in a place of sweet pineapple in the Isabela Province.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries such as seasonings, canned goods, coffee, sugar, eggs, drinks and more.

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos mayores  de edad y el menor de 13 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Ana además de estar al tanto de su hogar también se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende adornos y cerámicas, tiene un  local en su casa la cual queda en la carretera Portoviejo Guayaquil donde vende todo tipo de artesanía, día a día pasan por esta vía miles de personas que por lo general compran una que otra pieza en los locales que hay en el sector, trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, ella compra las artesanías  sin terminar  ya que así les sale más barato, luego ella las pinta y ella les da el toque final para luego venderla a sus clientes a muy buen precio. Lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía y pinturas. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro De la Mujer" communal bank meets every fortnight in la Pila, Montecristi Canton. This town is known throughout the province and the country for it's rich traditional culture. You can find a great variety of handicrafts here, made by the local inhabitants according to their traditional customs. 

Ana lives here. She is 42 years old, married and has three children from this relationship. Two of them are adults and the youngest, 13 years old, studies in secondary school. Her husband is a craftsman. Ana, besides taking care of her house is a business woman. She buys and sells ornaments and ceramics. She has a shop in her house located on the Portoviejo-Guayaquil highway where she sells all kinds of handicrafts. Every day thousand of people pass through here and generally buy something or other in the shops located in the area. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. She constantly buys the handicrafts so she gets them cheaper. Then she paints them and adds the final touches to them. Then she sells them to her clients at a good price. She has been doing this business for eight years now and things are going well. 

Ana will use this loan to buy more handicrafts and paints. She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because of the help she get with the loans. Her dream is to continue going forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts and paints.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells wheat grains to supplement her income. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Myriam Dalinda

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Myrian, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Myriam con la intención de ayudarle a su marido, realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de  adornos y cerámicas, el viaja con todos sus productos a varias ciudades de la sierra lugares donde tiene  sus clientes, viaja una vez por semana y se queda de dos a tres días en  estos lugares y regresa a preparar lo necesario para volver a viajar. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona ya que  son de muy buena calidad.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede  ayudarle a su esposo. 
Su sueño es comprar un carro ya que  su esposo viaja en transporte público.
texts.en:
The "Para el Futuro De la Mujer" communal bank meets every fortnight in la Pila, Montecristi Canton. This town is known throughout the province and the country for it's rich traditional culture. You can find a great variety of handicrafts here, made by the local inhabitants according to their traditional customs. 

Myrian lives here. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. They are all grown, two of them still live with her and study at university and secondary school. Her husband is a craftsman.

Myrian with the intention of helping her husband has requested the loan for his business. He buys and sells ornaments and ceramics. He travels with his products to various cities in the mountains where he has customers. He travels once a week, spends two or three days there and returns home to prepare the things he needs to travel again. He buys his products from craftsmen in the area as it is of high quality. This loan is to buy more handicrafts of all kinds. Myrian has been a member of the communal bank since it's initiation and she enjoys the loans as she can help her husband. Her dream is to buy a car as her husband travels by public transportation.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hard working woman who strives hard to make both ends meet. She is supporting her family fully from what she earns in her business and she appreciates the previous loan that helped her to buy more stock for her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of  30,000 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for sale to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for sale

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana, age 37, is a mother of five children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material for work. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.  However due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Rizwana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials like threads, beads, ribbons, etc. Rizwana is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 49 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. She as a part of a two-person group requesting a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She wants the financing to invest in supplies/accessories like cell phone batteries, chargers, casings, head phones, cell phone bags, etc. for her husband’s cell phone accessories shop. As this shop is the only source of income for their family, she wants to expand it through this financing and make her life happy. 

Her husband is very experienced and professional in his dealings and has been operating his business for the past ten years. Nasreen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them and bring positive changes in the life of their family.

loans.use: to expand a cell phone accessories shop

loans.name: Husan Bano

texts.en:
Husan Bano is 48 years old and a housewife.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of 7 children.  Her husband owns a general store in the market which is the only source of income for the family.  He sells a variety of products in his shop.  Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his supply, his net income, and his savings.  However, due to the lack of profit, he finds it difficult.  

Therefore, his wife Husan Bano has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase flour, salt, sugar, shampoo, rice, pulses and other items, and sell them in the market at a profitable price.  She will save the profit to pay school fees for her children.  Husan Bano is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, salt, sugar, shampoo, rice, pulses and other items to sell.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is the leader of this three-person loan group. She is 51 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. 

Therefore Bilqees has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Bilqees is so very thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is running a general store in the village of Militar in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, where the family lives. She has been doing this business for eight years as an aid to her husband's income. She works in her store every day in order to provide for the needs of her four children. She has taken a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy more grocery items like sardines, sugar, dairy products, etc. With this investment, she hopes to earn more profits and plans to save a portion of them for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like sardines, sugar, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is married with four children. Her husband provides for the family's needs from their fishing business, the family's main source of income. She had to double her efforts because she has four children who need support. She has taken a loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to repair her existing boat pump machine. She is hopeful to gain more from it to improve the living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to repair the existing boat pump machine

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vanh's Group

texts.en:
Vanh is a 33-year-old and married mother of four children, three of whom are still in school while another one is too young for school. Vanh is originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To struggle for a living, she and her husband do rice paddy farming on three hectares of farmland to support the family. The current business earns their family about 42,500 KHR (Cambodia Riels) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

The main challenge for her business is too many insects and weeds. Those are reasons why their rice cannot grow well. To overcome this challenge, Vanh joins a group of two to get a new loan. This is the fifth-cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans, which she has repaid back, have improved her family's living conditions, much better than before. Now, the total loan amount requested for the entire group loan is 1,100,000 KHR, of which 500,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy insecticide and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to increase her income from her current business to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn runs a business buying and selling charcoal to earn a living. Her income is good enough to provide for the needs of her children. Her previous loan taken from GDMPC that was used to purchase coconut shells was successfully repaid. She is now taking a new loan of 9,000 PHP to repair the pedicab used in her business. She also earns income from the pedicab through rentals. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the pedicab used in her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school.  For the past 10 years, David has been working hard to manage his stationary shop, which sells stationary items such as books and printing services. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more items for printing such as reams of paper which will help David generate greater profits; allowing him to improve his family's standard of living and enroll his children in better schools.  David hopes that in the future he will be able to own a business space of his own and stop renting. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more printing supplies such as reams of paper.

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. He lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Iwan is married and has children.

Iwan began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. He feels really excited about expanding his business. Last month, he made around $5 to $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took out a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ma. Sally

texts.en: Ma. Sally helps her husband in running their own fishing business while she also buys and sells fish in the market to earn a living. Her previous loan that was used for fishing materials was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more fish to resell in addition to their own caught fish. She hopes and dreams to have a better life and to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe owns a business in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, raising fish to sell. For eight years, the business has been successful and her previous loan taken from GDMPC has been repaid. She plans to buy a pedicab for transportation services using her business profits and her new loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC micro finance. She hopes to earn additional profits and be able to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pedicab for transportation services

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 60 years old, married and living in the Gurjaani district with her husband Valiko.  The couple receives monthly retirement pension payments.  Lamara works at the local water company and Valiko is a welder, working on special projects from the house.  They work hard to cover food and every day costs.

In order to generate more income Lamara has decided to apply for a loan and restart a business trading household items among her community members.  Lamara used to trade linens and blankets nearly five years ago and has experience in this field.  With the loan she will travel to Turkey (neighboring country) and purchase a stock of merchandise for resale.  Clothing and household items are cheaper in Turkey than in Georgia and transportation costs are not expensive.  Lamara will transport the items and give her customers the opportunity to buy items and pay later.  This initiative will attract many customers and Lamara will generate income.  She will continue the business and invest her funds in trading again to increase sales volume.  Lamara appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase household items for resale.

loans.name: Julia Solanda

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad pero tres de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es discapacitado y ya no trabaja.
Doña Julia para salir adelante con los gastos del hogar y al ver que su esposo no puede trabajar se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas, ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden, lleva más de 11 años con su negocio y  gracias a él pueden salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio y con los siguientes lo ha ido mejorando. 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Montecristi, the Banco Comunal Para el Futuro De la Mujer [Community Bank for the Future of Women] meets every fifteen days. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture. In this place one can find a wide variety of crafts that are made by its inhabitants, following the traditional customs.

In this place lives Julia, who is 59 years old. She is married and has four adult children, three of whom still live with her. Her husband is disabled and no longer works.

As her husband is unable to work, Julia runs a business to move forward with the household expenses. She has a small grocery store in their house, where she sells all kinds of groceries as well as legumes, vegetables and fruits, miscellaneous items, and stationery. She works every day from 6:00 until 20:00, and sometimes even later. Their children help with the work when they can. They have had the business for more than 11 years, and it allows them to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy groceries to restock the shop. She has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan and has been improving it with subsequent loans.

Her goals are to move forward in her business and for her shop to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 20 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly and so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rehana is so thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Younis

texts.en:
Younis is 47. He is married and has to look after his five young children and old parents as well, but he hardly spends time with his family due to his business. He owns a spare parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; he sells spare parts for auto rickshaws. His shop is situated in the spare parts market and it is challenging for him to sell his products among his competitors, because in his area most of the people are likely to drive auto rickshaws by profession and need to replace depreciated parts from time to time. To cope with the competitors he has to maintain stock of each spare part so that he does not have to refuse any customers because the refusal of any demand makes a bad impression on customers and sales as well. 

Nowadays, Younis is unable to buy inventory for his shop because he has been spending most of his income on household expenses. So he has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy all the important items including expensive and cheap spare parts. Younis is tension-free after taking this loan because BRAC showed him a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy auto rickshaw spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Ana Soledad

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres de sus antepasados.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 36años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  14 y 4  años, el mayor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es artesano.       
Doña Ana es una gran ama de casa que para tener sus propios recursos instalo un local en las afueras de su casa, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía y gas de uso domestico  lo cual empezó hace mas de 2 años y le deja muy buenos ingresos ya  que en el sector  son pocos los lugares que venden gas el cual es  tan necesario para los hogares,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta 21h00, lleva más  de 12 años dedicada  a la venta de cerámicas y al gas 2 años. 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía y bombonas de gas que es lo que más ganancias le deja. Está  en el Banco Comunal 8 años y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para salir adelante. 
Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the parish of Montecristi Canton, the communal bank “Para el Futuro de la Mujer” (For the Future of Women) meets every fifteen days. This place is very well known in the province and the country for its rich traditional culture. Here you can find a great variety of handicrafts that are made by the residents according to the customs of their ancestors. 

In this place lives Ana; she is 36 years old and is married. From this relationship they have two children of 14 and 4 years. The oldest is in high school. Her husband is an artisan.

Ana is a wonderful homemaker who, in order to have her own resources, installed a small store outside her house. There, she sells all kinds of handiworks, and gas for household use. She started more than 2 years ago and gets very good earnings, because in her area there are very few places that sell gas, which is so necessary for the houses. 

She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She has been selling handicrafts for more than 12 years and gas for 2 years. 

This loan is to purchase more handiwork and gas canisters, which provides her with the most income. She has been in the communal bank for 8 years, and she likes it because of the help that they give in getting ahead. 

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts and gas cylinders.

loans.name: Nabeel Group

texts.en: Nabeel is 25 years old, a hard working and independent widow. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her daughter, who is studying in third grade. For 10 years, Nabeel has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason, she is a member of a two-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan to Kiva and than she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a 41 year old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells agricultural products which he buys from other farmers but also practices farming in order to support his family. Like most traders in this business he is challenged by poor road networks and inadequate capital. His dream is to own a food store that can supply his customers all year round.Sunday intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Sedrack

texts.en: Sedrack is a 33 year old married man with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells pork which is a delicacy to most people around the area and the business is very lucrative. With the proceeds he has been able to buy land on which he practices farming. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose a challenge to their business growth. His dream is to own a good and modern restaurant so as to attract more customers. Sedrack intends to use the loan to buy pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Sarom lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district in the Battambang Province. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. She has been planting rice for 10 years, and it has returned her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro-loan for Sarom's group, which consists of two borrowers through VisionFund (Kiva's partner). As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes it will help her double her cash crop yield so that she can earn more money and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo José Luis y su hija de un año, ellos viven  en una casa alquilada, cerca de sus familiares. Ruth se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, maíz, diferentes verduras como culantro, zanahoria y lechuga desde muy tempranas horas del día, junto a su esposo. Ambos llevan sembrando 3 años, las técnicas agrícolas, las aprendieron de sus padres, quienes crecieron en las tierras que ahora les pertenecen, pero que antes eran de sus progenitores. También cultivan chacras arrendadas, para hacer producir en mayor cantidad sus productos, a ella, le gusta cosechar tubérculos (papa), pues le gusta recogerlos de entre los surcos, para luego comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, donde ya tiene conocidos por la calidad de sus cosechas, pero lo difícil es trasladar su producción hasta el punto de venta, por los pesados que son los sacos, las ganancias que perciben de su actividad, las vuelven a invertir y hasta pueden ahorrar para más adelante, construir su casa propia, adquirir más tierras productivas, donde podrá sembrar papa de la variedad amarilis, chancan y única, pues son más comerciales. Este es su cuarto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Motivo por el que se compromete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ruth, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old. She lives with her husband José Luis and her one-year-old daughter. They live in a rented house close to their relatives. 

Ruth works farming potatoes, peas, beans, corn, and different vegetables like cilantro, carrots, and lettuce. She starts working in the early hours of the morning along with her husband. They have been farming together for 3 years. They learned farming techniques from their parents, who were raised on the land that now belongs to them, but that previously was their ancestors’. 

They also cultivate a small rented farm in order to produce their crops in greater quantities. She likes harvesting tubers (potato) because she enjoys collecting them from the furrows in order to sell them later in the market in the city of Tarma, where she is known for the quality of her harvests. However, it is difficult for her to transport her products to the place of sale because of the heaviness of the sacks. 

From the earnings that she gets from her work, she invests and saves them so that in the future, she can build her own house and acquire more productive land where she will be able to farm amaryllis, chancan, and other rare varieties of potato, as they are more marketable. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva; in all this time, she has shown herself to be a responsible and committed person with her association. She is motivated by committing to be punctual with her quotas. Ruth will invest the S/.3000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 30-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also practices farming in order to earn a living. Price fluctuations and the high cost of transportation are his major challenges and his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Moses intends to use the loan to buy cooking oil, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Cloutirde

texts.en:
Cloutirde is 51 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she would like to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers to use during her maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 26 years old and married with three children. Two of them are still in school and another one is too young for school. To make a living, she grows corn and pineapple as the main source of income. Having been with this business for five years, she is able to earn about 21,400 KHR per day. Inadequate capital is the main challenge for her crop field. To overcome this challenge, she formed a group of two members to get a first loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). As the leader, she is going to use this portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her agribusiness. She hopes to earn more income from her business, so she can improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her agribusiness

loans.name: Farzand Ali

texts.en:
Farzand Ali is a 58-year-old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  He is the father of three sons and four daughters. 

He is a very hard worker and an honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers a menu of Pakistani foods such as kabab and haleem at noon. He has been running this restaurant for many years with the help of his elder son. He is earning a good profit from the restaurant and cherishing his family well.

He cooks delicious food and people like to eat at his restaurant. His elder son is a married person and fully responsible for the basic needs of his family. He wants to offer more menus three times a day and wants to buy new furniture so that they could earn sufficient income for both families. But he does not have money to buy food items for cooking.

Therefore, Farzand Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he could buy food items such as cooking oil, grains, eggs, flour, rice and new furniture. 

Farzand Ali says thank to Kiva and appreciates the warmth support for him.

loans.use: to buy food items

loans.name: Mericel

texts.en:
Mericel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mericel is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mericel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mericel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, seasonings, frozen foods, etc. for her business.

Mericel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mericel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, seasonings, frozen foods, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a 37-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the university level. She has been in farming for the last 17 years and her main hardship is seasonal weather variations due to the effects of climate change. She has a vision of venturing into modern farming methods to increase the quality of her yields and educate her children up to the University. Teddy intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married mother with three children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. 

She has operated a small shop, selling goods at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en: Sanije lives in a Roma community and is the mother of two children. She is a housewife and her husband works in the electric company with very low salary. As with most families that live in the Roma communities of Kosovo, their lives have been difficult and they have a poor standard of living. The money her husband generates is not enough to pay for the construction that they started but were unable to finish to add an additional room for her children in their home. This loan will help her and her family to have a better place to live and give her children a room in their very small house. She hopes in the future to be able to have a better quality of life and living conditions for her family and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To add an additional room for her children

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married and blessed with four children, two of whom attend school while the others are still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She cooks food in her cafe to sell at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a hotel business in the future.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, aged 59 years, is a widowed woman with six children, three of whom attend school and the others are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling goods from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mwaka dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her early thirties, is married with two sons who are in school. For five years now, Josephine has had two businesses. One is a shop selling dry food like sugar, salt, maize flour, baking flour, rice, beans and other foods. She is managing another tailoring business. Josephine starts working from 06:00am to 09:00pm daily and is able to make a good return per month. 

This will be her 16th loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy a new tailoring machine, tailoring materials and other new working equipment. She managed also to open her food shop business and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Josephine used her business profit to pay for her house building costs and covered school fees, household expenses and reinvested back to her business. She will use this loan to restock more foods in her shop to resell. She dreams of opening a successful business which could make her life better.

Josephine will share this loan with her loan group Mt Usambara which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more foods in her shop to resell.

loans.name: Gulbala

texts.en:
Gulbala is 35 years old. He is married with one child. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city. Now Gulbala lives in Seyidehmedli village in the Fuzuli region. His wife is a house wife and Gulbala is a market seller.  He sells vegetables like potatoes, onions, and cucumbers at the local market.

Gulbala has spent over 9 years working in the local market. Today he plans to increase his business, but currently he sells only vegetables. He needs 1,000 AZN to buy fruits for his local shop to increase his monthly income. In this way he will sell more products and earn more money. In the future he wants to have a car and improve his shop.

He thanks Komak and Kiva for the loan and for helping him increase his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 57-year-old man with 10 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He practices agriculture and with the proceeds he has been able to earn enough money to build rental houses from which he earns a monthly income. Like most farmers he is faced with challenges of price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes. His dream is to become a model farmer in the region. John intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pay workers who are weeding his garden.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay workers who are weeding his garden.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 24-year-old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh foods, but also practices farming in order to earn a living. Inadequate capital and lack of adequate preservation equipment pose a challenge to his business. His dream is to export the bananas to other countries. Christopher intends to use the loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en: Rem is 52 years old, married, and a mother of four children living in a village of the Thmor Koul district. She still has one child who relies on her. The source of her family's income is mainly from rice farming on four hectares. She has been in this business for ten years. Her main business challenge is lack of working capital to increase crop yield. Rem has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for seven loan cycles already. She paid back the previous loans, which enabled her to maintain positive conditions for her family. She is leading her group of two to get another loan from VisionFund. She and her co-borrower are seeking a loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Rem wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to set aside some money for her family needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees for her farmland

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone.  She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. With the loan she would be able to consistently meet increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to cover personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 23 años de edad, es técnica radióloga y sigue estudiando para obtener su título de Licenciada, está trabajando como ayudante en un Hospital, le pagan solo un poco por lo que hace, pero ella está contenta porque consiguió ese pequeño puesto porque piensa que podrá con el tiempo seguir trabajando allí pero con el salario que se merece con su título logrado. 
Ayuda a su familia en lo que puede, su madre es soltera y tiene tres hermanos, uno es menor, dos de ellos también trabajan y una estudia en la Universidad. Viven en una pequeña casa y su madre tiene un kiosco y venta de helados para el sustento de la familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir con su meta de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Claudia, 23, is a radiology technician who is studying toward her bachelor's degree.  She works as an assistant at a hospital and receives a small amount of money for what she does.  But she is happy with the job because she believes that over time she can continue her work there with a better salary once she has her degree.

She helps her family when she can since she is single and has three siblings, one of whom is a minor.  The other two work and study at the university.  They live in a small house and her mother has an ice cream stand to earn an income for the family.

Claudia is requesting a loan to pay education costs so she can work toward her goal of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy luchadora, que está estudiando y trabajando para salir adelante. Tiene un hijo, y cuenta que es madre soltera, ella es docente en una escuela experimental y está estudiando a la vez.
Quiere presentar su tesina como para obtener el título de Licenciada y así tener mejor ingreso para llevar una mejor vida a su hijo, quien es su mayor fortaleza e inspiración.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, con lo que podrá cubrir los gastos que esto acarrea. También agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Maria is a tenacious woman who is studying and working to get ahead.  She is a single mother, with a son, and works as a teacher at an experimental school, while also studying herself.

She wants to present her thesis for her bachelor's degree so she can improve her income and lead a better lifestyle with her son who is her greatest strength and inspiration.

She is requesting a loan to pay for education costs, and is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Lilian Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Lilian, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es el presidente de la Junta Parroquial.
Doña Lilian para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica al comercio, ella compra y vende adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas y que por lo general pasan comprando algo todos los días, allí vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos los compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados y luego ella le da el acabado necesario para que estén listos para la venta.
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Lleva más de 5 años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para su negocio. 
Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the communal bank "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" meets in the La Pila in the Montecristi Canton.  It is a very well-known place in the province and country due to its rich traditional culture.  There is a wide variety of crafts here made by the local people who follow traditional customs.

This is where Lilian, 46, lives.  She is married and has two adult chldren, one of whom still lives at home.  Her husband is the president of the Parish Board of Directors.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Lilian buys and sells ornaments and pottery.  She has a shop on the main street where many people shop every day.  She sells all kinds of crafts and works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  For over 20 years she has been in the business and it has gone well for her.  She buys semi-finished crafts which she finishes and sells.

The loan is to buy a wider variety of different crafts for her business.  She has been in the communal bank for over five years and enjoys it because the loans are of great help to her business.

Her goal is to continue prospering.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es de la ciudad de Itá, y cuenta que de aquí a cierto tiempo se ve como una buena profesional, que podrá conseguir más horas cátedras para así tener más ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Está estudiando la carrera de ciencias en la educación y comenta que como estudiante se considera buena, tiene buenas calificaciones y siempre se esfuerza por poder sobresalir pese a los problemas del día a día
Comenta además que ella está casada, que tiene 2 hijas quienes son su mayor inspiración.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchas gestiones y papeleos que hacer, los cuales tienen muy alto costo.
texts.en:
Estela is from the city of Itá and claims she sees herself as a good professional in the near future.  She wants to further her education to increase her income and help her family.

She is studying toward a degree in education and feels she is a good student.  Her grades are good and she always makes an effort to stand out despite her daily problems.

Estela is married and has two daughters who are her greatest inspiration.  She is requesting a loan to pay for education costs since she has a lot of expensive paperwork to be handled.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Letty María

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.
En este lugar vive la señora Letty, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un niño de 6  años de edad, el cual estudia en escuela, actualmente está embarazada de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Letty junto al esposo  se dedica al comercio, ellos compran y venden  de adornos hechos en tagua y cerámicas en diversidad de formas y tamaños,  tienen un  local en la vía principal lugar por donde pasan muchas personas que a diario compran en su local, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, ellos compran estas obras a artesanos de la zona pero sin pintar y luego ellos le dan el acabado adecuado para venderlos a muy buen precio. Llevan más de  10 años que se dedican a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos y pinturas para darles el terminado a sus objetos. Lleva más de 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. 
Su sueño es tener a su bebe y que nazca bien.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Para el Futuro de la Mujer" meets every 15 days in La Pila in the Montecristi Canton.  The place is very well-known in the province and country for its rich traditional culture.  Here many crafts are made by the local people who follow traditional customs.

Letty, 30, lives here.  She and her common-law husband have a six-year-old son who attends school and she is pregnant with her second child.  Her husband is a merchant.

Letty and her husband buy and sell ornaments made from seeds, and pottery in different shapes and sizes.  They have a shop on the main street that many shoppers visit daily and their work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  They buy unfinished the crafts from artisans who visit the area, but then finish and sell them at a good price.  For over ten years they have been in business and able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy a wider variety of crafts and paint to finish the goods.  Letty has been a member of the communal bank for over five years and she enjoys it because the loans are very helpful.

Her dream is to have a healthy baby.

loans.use: To buy crafts and paint.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en:
Frederic is 52 years old and has been a maize farmer for twenty years. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support his labor costs and buy fertilizers in order to improve his maize production. With the profits from his farming, he would like to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and labor for maize production

loans.name: Sarean

texts.en: Sarean is a rural villager from Kandal Province's Sa Ang District, where crop farming is a popular local business. She is 43 years old and a widowed mother of two sons.
