She would also like to finish fixing up her home because it needs work, including plastering, fixing the roof, which has deteriorated a bit, etc.  Her dream is to save, so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life and send them to a university where they can study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Mukhlisa

texts.ru: Мухлиса 42-летняя женщина, занимающаяся животноводством. Она замужем, имеет четверых детей. Ее муж и двое сыновей уехали на заработки в другой город. Она с сыном и дочкой живут в городе Исфара. Дети учатся в школе. Сама Мухлиса выращивает мелкорогатый и крупнорогатый скот. Она занимается данной деятельностью во дворе своего дома. У Мухлисы сейчас остались считанные барашки, двое из которых отображены на фотографии. Мухлиса имеет большой коровник и хочет там увеличить поголовья скота. Для этого он просит кредит. На сумму кредита Мухлиса планирует купить трех голов коров лучшей породы, которые стоят дорого. Для Мухлисы работа на скотном дворе  - это не только любимое дело, но и полезно потраченное время. Дети Мухлисы большую часть дня проводят в школе, и Мухлиса сидит дома одна. Вот и в течение 8 лет она ухаживает за скотами, и таким образом зарабатывает деньги для семьи. В данный момент Мухлиса действительно нуждается в кредите для развития своего животноводческого бизнеса. Она просит поддержки у Вас!
texts.en:
Mukhlisa is a 42 year old woman, who is working with livestock breeding. She is married and has four children. Her husband and two sons left to be migrant workers in another city. Mukhlisa lives in the city of Isfara with one son and a daughter. The children go to school. Mukhlisa breeds sheep, goats and cattle. She works with this business in her yard. 

Mukhlisa currently has a few lambs, two of which are shown in the photo. Mukhlisa has a large cattle barn and would like to increase the number of cattle there. She requests a loan to do this. For the loan amount, Mukhlisa plans to purchase three heads of cattle of the best breed, which is expensive. 

For Mukhlisa, working in the cattle yard is not only her beloved work, but also a good way to spend time. Mukhlisa's children spend the larger part of the day in school, and Mukhlisa is home alone. She has taken care of cattle for a period of 8 years, and this way she earns money for the family. Currently Mukhlisa really needs a loan to develop her cattle breeding business. She asks for help from you!

loans.use: to purchase three cows of the best breed to increase the number of cattle and develop her busines

loans.name: Suth

texts.en:
Suth is 29 years old and lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She has been involved in a farming business for more than 10 years, and it is the major source of her family’s income. She primarily plants rice and cassava on her own farmland. She sells the crops into the market of the province in the harvest season, normally earning approximately KHR 40,000 per day.

Currently, Suth would like to expand her business by purchasing an additional plot of land for cultivating rice. But she has inadequate capital to make it possible. That’s why she has applied for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, in the amount of KHR 4,000,000. She hopes lenders will not reject her loan and will give her this opportunity of a loan, which will enable her to go further in developing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of land, for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 32 years old and a married woman. She is a hardworking lady, who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She will use it to buy a stock of thread, zippers, buttons and lace, in various colors, which will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, zippers, buttons and lace, in various colors.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is 25 years old and married, the mother of one.  

She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en: Kolu, age 49, had to stop her education in the ninth grade. She is married and lives in the town of Paynesville South. Her husband works for a government agency, and they are the parents of four boys who are between the ages of 18 and 28. Their oldest child lives outside the home and is independent while the other three stay with her at home and are all in college. Kolu runs a shop where she sells food and other items such as biscuits, bath soap, sugar, bread, sardines and lunch meat. Because of the location of her shop, she does well and uses her profits to repay her loans and buy more items to sell. She has requested her fourth loan to buy more inventory, and hopes to own and run a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sardines, bread, biscuits and bath soap for her business.

loans.name: Begimjon

texts.ru: Бегимчон  очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет двух взрослых сыновей. Бегимчон живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Сама она работает учительницей родного языка в местном училище. Чтобы зарабатывать на проживание Бегимчон занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже несколько лет она занимается откормом и продажей скота. Два её сына работают плотниками. В данный момент они занимаются построением жилищных домов частных лиц и получают от этого приемлемый доход. Муж Бегимчон тоже работает учителем в школе. Сейчас Бегимчон хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота. Она обратилась в Арванд для того, чтобы получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Begimjon is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has two adult sons. Begimjon lives with her family in a small village. She works as a teacher of her native language at the local school. 

In order to earn enough money for living, Begimjon also has her own business. She has worked with fattening and selling livestock for several years already. Her two sons work as carpenters. Currently they work with building private homes and receive a reasonable pay for this. Begimjon's husband also works as a teacher at the school. 

Currently Begimjon would like to increase the number of livestock. She turned to Arvand in order to get a loan to purchase some livestock. She hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed and has six children. None of her children goes to school, but she takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees for the grandchildren and paying for utility bills.

She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use it to buy more bunches of green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, ground nuts, fish, rice, charcoal, chicken and beef. 

Imelda earns additional income from renting out rooms. Her major business challenges include rainy seasons and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and ingredients for meals, including rice, fish, chicken and beef

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 50 años , está casado con Yolanda y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juan se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos como; papa, olluco y oca; ya que desde niño creció entre la vegetación y los terrenos agrícolas, por lo que el trabajo en el campo, es lo que más le gusta. Desde que formo su propia familia comenzó a sembrar en terrenos alquilados, pero gracias a la dedicación que brinda a sus sembríos los que cultiva, abona y cuida constantemente consigue vender sus cosechas, en el mercado central de su ciudad, obteniendo buenas ganancias; los que hicieron que ahora con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro obtuviera sus propios terrenos agrícolas, minimizando así gastos que le permiten obtener un dinero extra, además de pensar en aumentar la cantidad que produce. Juan; desea mejorar la construcción de su casa, para brindar una excelente calidad de vida a sus hijos, ya que ahora puede proyectarse a otras adquisiciones. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juan, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Juan, age 50, is married to Yolanda. He has two children with whom he lives in his own house. Juan grows tubers like potatoes, olluco, and oca. Ever since he was a boy he grew up among vegetation and farmland. Therefore, he works in the fields, which is what he likes the most. Ever since he formed his own family, he started to plant on rented land. Thanks to his dedication to the crops he grows, the fertilizer, and the constant care, he manages to sell his harvest for good profits at the local market. With much effort and saving this allowed him to now get his own land. This minimizes his expenses and allows him to get extra money. In addition to thinking about increasing the quantity that he produces, Juan wants to improve the construction of his house. He wants to do this in order to provide his children with an excellent quality of life. He is now able to project other acquisitions. This is his sixth loan with Kiva. He is grateful for the financial support given to him. This will help him with the progress in his business. He pledges to be punctual with his payments. Juan will use the 500 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kamoljon

texts.ru: Камолчону 28 лет. Он заботливый муж и отец 2 детей. Камолчон с семьей живет в родительском доме в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Он единственный кормилец семьи и сам содержит родителей, жену и детей. Ранее он предоставлял услугу такси, перевозил людей из одной точки города на другую. Однако работа таксиста в его районе не постоянная и не перспективная. Поэтому Комилчон решил начать собственный торговый бизнес по продаже детской и женской обуви. Он уже арендовал торговую точку на центральном рынке. Камолчон нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить товар. Он приобретет зимнюю обувь и займется продажей. Мы желаем ему удачи в начинаниях!
texts.en:
Kamoljon is 28 years old. He is an attentive husband and father of two children. Kamoljon lives in his native home with his family, in the region of B. Gafurov, in the city of Khujand. He is the only bread-winner in the family and supports his parents, wife and children by himself. 

Earlier Kamoljon provided a taxi service, driving people from one point of the city to another. However the work as a taxi driver in his region is variable and not promising. Therefore Kamoljon decided to start his own retail business, selling children's and women's shoes. He already rented a sales point at the central market. 

Kamoljon needs a loan to purchase goods. He will buy winter shoes and sell them. We wish him good luck in his endeavors!

loans.use: to purchase seasonal children's and women's shoes to start a retail business

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam is 41 years old and married, the mother of six children. 

She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community, and she makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of flower-making for the past one year. She offers various colorful flowers, for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies her flowers in the local market. She has good communication skills and has a good customer list.

Salma is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 15,000. She will use the funds to buy raw material for her craft, such as fabric, tissue and glace papers, and packs of paint in various colors. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family, and part to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material, such as fabric, tissue and glace papers, and packs of paint in various colors.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married, with five children, and four of her children go to school. 

She has a business of a retail shop, and she has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of beans, boxes of soap, maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar.  She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

She works in her shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality (rainy season, which hinders her customers to reach out to her). 

She aspires to own a wholesale shop and also to educate her children up to the university. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans, boxes of soap, cooking oil, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces the challenge of lack of enough capital in her business and she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 25-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past four years, has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of Rs. 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek is 33 years old, married and a loving mother of six children. It’s quite a big family, which results in financial constraints. She decided to help her husband earn income by selling fish in a local market of Prey Chhor district, in Kampong Cham province. She can make a net income of KHR 20,000 a day to distribute for food and other expenses. She mentioned that she really enjoys her business because she likes communicating with customers who come to visit her booth.

As of now, she would like to acquire a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more fish to sell. She believes that, through the investment as a result of the loan, it will enable her to increase her sales and make more profits, which she will use to ensure the overall welfare of her family and help her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ondougou Dah 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe ONDOUGOU DAH 1 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Ramata Pégné assise en deuxième position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 47.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé) et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the ONDOUGOU DAH 1 group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age with 4 children. They live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming tasks at the end of this winter season. This will be their second loan from the institution, after having repaid the last one. 

Onions are the main crop that they grow. Ramata Pégné is seated second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she hopes to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, from Bandiagara and Mopti, to both male and female customers.

She is counting on making 47,000 CFA Francs by the end of the season. This income will allow her to help her husband with family expenses (food, healthcare, and schooling for their children) and to reinvest what’s left in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es: Rómulo de 56 años está casado con Ambrosia, con quien tiene  8 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de 16 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia. Su carácter es apacible pero su trabajo demuestra su gran capacidad. A su edad se dedica a la agricultura, una actividad muy cansada, pero reconfortante. Cultiva papas en grandes cantidades. Mayormente en los meses de mayo, noviembre y diciembre. “En esta zona las papas harinosas crecen grandes y sanas, por eso su precio de venta siempre es favorable”, menciona.Rómulo empezó esta actividad desde que era joven, y después formó su familia. Ahora, con la experiencia de muchos años, aprendió a realizar otros negocios, como la venta de carne de carnero.  Considera que la mayor inversión se da en la compra de fertilizantes y en el pago de personal. De esta manera Rómulo trabaja y sale adelante. Está muy agradecido por al ayuda que se le brinda y la confianza, por eso esta vez también espera el apoyo para iniciar otra siembra de papas. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rómulo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de tubérculos.
texts.en:
Rómulo, 56 years old, is married to Ambrosia, with whom he has 8 children, though he only lives with the youngest who is 16 years old.  They live in their own house.  His personality is gentle, but his work shows his great capacity.  

At his age, he makes his living in agriculture, a tiring but comforting undertaking.  He grows potatoes in large quantities, primarily in the months of May, November and December.  "In this area, mealy potatoes grow big and well, which is why their sale price is always good," he says.

Rómulo began this activity when he was young, and later started his family.  Now, after many years' experience, he has learned to conduct other businesses, like selling mutton.  

He believes that the greatest investment is in purchasing fertilizers and paying personnel.  This is how Rómulo works and gets ahead.  He is very grateful for the help that is given to him and the trust.  This is why he is once again hoping for support to initiate another round of planting potatoes.  This is his third loan with Kiva, and he is very grateful for the financial support.  This will help him move his business forward.  Furthermore, he promises to be on time with his payments.  

Rómulo will invest the 3000 soles in the purchase of organic compost to fertilize his planted fields of tubers.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Aemiliya

texts.en:
Aemiliya is a student of AUCA's department of International and Comparative Politics. Below is her story:

“Education is an important aspect of life. Choosing the right college or university determines the quality of education. Good education affects future life. This issue must be approached very carefully.  Analyzing many universities of our country, I realized that AUCA is the perfect choice for me because it is one of the best universities in Central Asia. AUCA provides modern equipment that helps students during their studies. One of the important advantages of AUCA is that all the courses are taught in English. Another unique feature of this university is that students can choose their timetable suitable to them, as well as choose the most important academic classes. AUCA students have a chance to continue their studies abroad. 

I am a very sociable person and have lots of interests. I am interested in economics and politics, as well as journalism and psychology. That’s why it was really difficult to choose one of those departments. Then I ended up with the department of International and Comparative Politics, because from the ancient times, different countries had political inter-relations. Therefore, international relations became more important in politics.  Another opportunity is that every student of AUCA can apply for a Kiva loan. Kiva loans help AUCA students to cover their tuition fees. I would also like to apply for a Kiva loan so that I don’t have to think about the financial problems of a student’s life.”

loans.use: To pay university tuition fees

loans.name: Sweetie

texts.en:
Sweetie is 23 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is a high school graduate with a three-month-old child. She started a little artificial hair business four years ago.

Sweetie makes a lot of money during the holiday season, and desires to improve her business even more.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair and hopes to build a house for her child in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a married mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and father). She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Madina has a  retail shop that she has operated for 10 years, working seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation, ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda, and defaulters.

Madina has requested a loan of 2500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil.  She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a delivery van to ease transportation problems.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman, aged 31 years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her kids.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase more foods to sell, including bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 46 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She’s married with eight children between 6 and 27 years old, only six of whom are in school and living at home. She did not go to school. 

Cecelia runs a cook shop where she sells rice and soup. Sometimes she experiences losses, but most of the time she has very good sales. Cecelia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, meat, fish, etc. for her business. She plans to buy land and build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, meat, fish, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 43 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been stitching bed sheets, covers and pillows for the past 10 years. Her husband is employed in a shoe-making factory and cannot afford the fees to send their children to school. Nasreen dreams of sending her children to school so she took the initiative to start her own business. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, Nasreen has requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy bundles of cloth in different colors and designs and a stock of threads and laces. She wants to expand her business to earn better profits for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed sheets, cloth and spools of thread at bulk rates in large quantities.

loans.name: Ondougou Dah 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe ONDOUGOU DAH 2 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali.

Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Aïssa Kindié debout en deuxième position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 49.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé) et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

Onions are the main crop that they grow. Aïssa Kindié is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she hopes to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in villages, from Bandiagara and Mopti, to both male and female customers.

She is counting on making 49,000 CFA Francs by the end of the season. This income will allow her to help her husband with family expenses (food, healthcare, and schooling for their children) and to reinvest what’s left in her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 35 years old and married.  She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past three years. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous in providing good-quality products in her circle. 

She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is the mother of five: three daughters and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She also does sewing as her part-time job. In this way she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively. 

Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and hence her support for her family.
 
It’s her second year with the Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with its support.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Djènèba
 debout en troisième  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo.

She is counting on making 21,500 CFA Francs by the end of the season. This income will allow her to help her husband with family expenses (food, healthcare, and schooling for their children) and to reinvest what’s left in her business.

Les membres du groupe ONDOUGOU DAH 4 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Anta
 debout en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé) et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Ondougou Dah 4 group are all married women with an average age of 35 years and an average 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali. They have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better conduct their vegetable businesses in this end of the rainy season.

The women are on their second loan with the organization, their previous loan having been fully repaid. Anta, pictured standing on the far right of the photo, runs a primarily onion business. With this loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She sells her crops in the villages of Bandiagara and Mopti, after the harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. Anta hopes to earn a profit of 50,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This profit will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (food, education for their children, and basic health needs) and to reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ondougou Dah 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe ONDOUGOU DAH 5 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali.

 debout en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo.

They have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their vegetable businesses during this end of the rainy season. 

The women are on their first loan with the organization. Yandai, pictured standing on the far right of the photo, is primarily in the onion business. With her loan, she plans on purchasing seeds and fertilizer. She sells her crops in the villages of Bandiagara and Mopti, after the harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (food, education for their children, and basic health needs) and to reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

assise en deuxième  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the SOBODY 1 group are all married women, and average 39 years of age with 5 children. They live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the 5th administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their farming tasks at the end of this winter season. This will be their first loan with the institution. 

Onions are the main crop that they grow. Assatou is seated second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she hopes to buy seeds and fertilizer. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Bandiagara, to both male and female customers.

She is counting on making 25,000 CFA Francs by the end of the season. This income will allow her to help her husband with family expenses and to reinvest what’s left in her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia ya son varios años que s ededica a este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha.La socia soiicita el credito para comprar maiz para preparar la chicha.

La socia esta contenta con el credito anterior y se compromete a cumplr con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha is still in the business of selling chicha, which is a beverage made from corn. She has been in this line of work for several years and does very well. Her dream is to expand her chicha sales business. The member requests the loan in order to purchase corn for making chicha.

She's happy with the previous loan and she pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase corn for making chicha (a beverage).

loans.name: Ondougou Dah 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe ONDOUGOU DAH 6 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Djènèba
 debout en deuxième  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 22.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales (nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé) et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Ondougoou Dah 6 group are all married women with an average age of 36 years, an average of 5 children each, and living in polygamous families in Bandiagara in the 5th administrative region of Mali. They have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their agriculture businesses in this end of the rainy season. The women are on the first loan with the organization.

Djènèba, pictured standing second from right to left in the photo, is primarily in the onion business. With this loan, she plans on purchasing fertilizer and seeds. She sells her crops in the villages of Bandiagara and Mopti after her harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 22,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. This will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (food, education for their children, and basic health needs) and to reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Visitacion De Los Angeles

texts.es: Visitación tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la preparación de alimentos de menores en la escuela pública de su comunidad. Para ella y su compañero de vida lo más importante son sus hijos por lo que con sus pocas condiciones buscan la forma de ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida. En la actualidad no cuenta con energía eléctrica dentro de su humilde hogar por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la instalación de la energía eléctrica dentro de su vivienda y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Visitación is 36 years old. She lives with her life partner and two children aged 10 and 8 years in a house that she owns. She makes food for the children of the public school of her village. For her and her life partner, the most important thing are their children, which is why they search for ways to gradually improve their living conditions with what little they have. She currently doesn't have electricity in her humble home, and that's why she decided to request this loan from FUSAI so she can install electricity in her house and provide better conditions for her children.

loans.use: to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Ondougou Dah 9 Group

Yanéme, pictured standing second from right to left in the photo, is primarily in the onion business. With this loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She sells her crops in the villages of Bandiagara and Mopti after her harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 23,000 francs CFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (food, education for their children, and basic health needs) and to reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage.

They have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their agricultural businesses during this end of the rainy season. The women are on their first loan with the organization.

Ramata, pictured first on the left in the photo, is primarily in the onion business. With this loan, she plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She sells her crops in the villages of Bandiagara and Mopti after her harvest, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 22,000 francs CFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses (food, education for their children, and basic health needs) and to reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Justa Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BATAN ORCCO, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia también sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones para su negocio de venta de ropa.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "BATAN ORCCO."  She is continuing with her business selling clothing.  She has been making her living with this business for years.  It brings her both financial and personal satisfaction.  She makes her sales as a street vendor to customers who request her goods, and she also earns money raising small animals.  She hopes to be able to continue working in order to continue helping her family. 
This member is requesting the loan in order to purchase pants for her clothing sales business. 
She feels grateful for the loan that has been granted, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase pants for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Norma Deysi

texts.es: Norma de 39 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos que con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo van sacando adelante. Norma se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras en el mercado central de su comunidad y es así como colabora con la economía de su hogar.  Su casita es muy humilde pero es propia y su deseo es mejorarla poco a poco. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra ladrillo, cemento y arena para levantar las paredes de su casa ya que no están terminadas y las lluvias se filtran y dañan sus pertenencias. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Norma is 39 years old and has four children. Alongside her husband, she has been getting her children ahead through a great deal of effort. Norma sells fruits and vegetables at the central market of her village and that's how she contributes to her household finances. Her small house is very modest but she owns it and wishes to improve it little by little. She requests this loan from FUSAI so she can use it to purchase bricks, cement and sand. That way she'll build her house walls, since they're not finished yet, and the rain water seeps in and damages her belongings. She hopes to get this support and therefore provide more safety for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand so she can build her house walls.

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County, Liberia. She is single, with four children between the ages of 3 and 11 who are attending school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, Watta has run a local restaurant in the local market. She makes more profits sometimes, but most of the time, business is slow.

She is requesting her third loan to purchase more rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business. 

Her plan for the future is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, charcoal, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville South. She is married, her husband is a teacher, and they have three children.  The youngest is 14, and the oldest 20. She attended school and completed sixth grade.  All her children go to school; the oldest is already in college. 

Since 1991 Jenneh has been selling rice and soup in a local restaurant. She learned to be a business person from her mother. About her own business, she says sometimes you gain and sometimes you lose but "it makes me strong to stand on my own". 

Jenneh has requested a loan to purchase pepper, oil, fish, vita, and other food ingredients. She hopes to support her children until they all finish school.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, oil, fish, vita, and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Zubeeda

texts.en: Zubeeda is a 32-year-old married woman. She makes sweets and confectionery with the help of her husband who is also shown in the picture. They are experienced in this field and have a good client list. She is a mother of six children. Only three of the children are school going due to financial conditions. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, health and education. Zubeeda wants to grow her business and has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stock of sugar, flavors, creams and flour to meet with the increasing demands of their customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits to provide a better quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flavorings, cream and flour.

loans.name: Dedicación

texts.es: Dedicación, de 47 años, enviudo hace tres años de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Está valerosa mujer, se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de, papa, oyuco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde vende su cosecha, a muy buen precio. Según cuenta Dedicación, baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de cordero al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió, y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabajarlo para sus hijos. Este es su sexto crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero otorgado, este le ayudará en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Dedicación, invertirá los S/.600 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos,
texts.en: Dedicación is 47 years old, her husband Maurilio died three years ago so she is a widow. They have 5 children but only 2 of them live in their own homes. She is a brave woman who grows tubers such as potatoes, oyuco, and yams. What she likes the most are the moments when she travels from her farmland to the city, where she sells her crops at a good prices. According to Dedicación, she goes to Tarma city where she sells her nutritious tubers. She also sells mutton at wholesale, and with the sales she an buy her food for the week. She is thankful to God for all that she has the support she has received, and in spite of the hard work that is farming, she is happy to be able to have what she has and to work the farm with her children. This is her sixth loan with KIVA, for which she is thankful for the financial support provided to her. This will help her business progress. In addition she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Dedicación will invest the S/.600 soles in buying organic fertilizer to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Norma tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes. Ella trabajo por varios años en una compañía bananera. Por necesidad de obtener ingresos decidió poner su negocio de venta de comidas como ser almuerzos, tamales, refrescos, dulces, churros, galletas y otros. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como carnes, frijoles, harina, manteca para elaborar la comida y también refrescos, churros, dulces para vender. Con esta inversión espera superar las ventas y obtener buenos ingresos. Ella esta motivada a seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Norma is 48 years old and a single mother. She has three children and lives in the village of La Lima, department of Cortes. She worked for a banana company for several years. Out of the need to get an income, she decided to start her food sales business such as meals, tamales, refreshments, sweets, churro fritters, crackers, etc. The loan she's requesting is for 10,000 lempiras and she'll use it to purchase supplies such as meat, beans, flour and butter for making food, and also refreshments, churro fritters and sweets for selling. With this investment she hopes to increase her sales and make a good profit. She's motivated to keep on working and make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat, beans, flour and butter for making food, and also refreshments, churro fritters and sweets for selling.

loans.name: Norga Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia tambien prepara sandwichs y lo sigue llevando a diferentes colegios,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in her restaurant business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. The member also prepares sandwiches which she takes to different schools. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.. She has had this business for several years and it is going well. She dreams of expanding her restaurant business. She seeks a loan to buy cooking products such as beef, chicken and vegetables. 

The member is happy to have the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as beef, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia María Luisa continua dedicándose al negocio de costurera, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia confecciona pantalones, vestidos, blusas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas entre otros para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Our member María Luisa continues working in her sewing business, which she has had for years. Her business is going well thanks to the determination she puts in every day into her business. She makes pants, dresses, blouses and other items. She wishes to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family. The member seeks a loan to buy fabrics and other items for her business. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other items for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old married man with two school-age children living in the village of Dzegvi near the capital city of Georgia. His wife works as a cleaner at the local hospital and her monthly salary is nearly $110. The family is raising a calf and plans to sell it in November to generate income. They live in poverty and hardly cover the feeding costs.

In order to generate income, John decided to purchase a second-hand car to use as a taxi. As there is a high unemployment rate in the region, self-employment is the only way for people to earn a living. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, John applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2000 will help John to start a taxi business. John is very enthusiastic and is a hardworking person with a great desire to provide his children with a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. John is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of five children, all of whom go to school. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way he earns ansufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Hameeda contacted Kashf foundation and has applied for her fourth loan of 10,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. Hameeda is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate for her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 38 years old and married, the mother of four.  She is a hard-working mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. 

She has been tailoring for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Lidia Teresa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia estos productos lleva a puerto maldonado ,la socia tambien lleva animales,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,cuyes,patos y pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lidia continues to dedicate herself to the business of selling rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil, plus farm animals. She brings these products and the animals to Puerto Maldonado. Lidia has devoted 7 years to her business and it's going well. Her dream is to have her own grocery store. 

Lidia is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, sugar, milk, guinea pigs, ducks and chickens. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, guinea pigs, ducks, and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia Leonarda sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar arroz y leche.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Leonarda continues working in her grocery store business. She has had this business for several years, and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items. She wishes to be able to continue working and in this way support her family. The member seeks a loan to buy rice and milk. The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy rice and milk.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase four bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood and charcoal in the village.

loans.use: to purchase four bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años, su familia está conformada por su esposo, 5 hijos  que ya están casados y cuatro de ellos están en los estados unidos y uno esta con ella, el muchacho que vive con ella trabaja y está casado. Trabaja de albañil y realiza viaje en el carro que tiene, la señora se dedica a prestar servicio en la comunidad; con el molino que tiene en su casa ya que en la zona donde vive solo hay dos personas que tienen molinos, ella y otro señor que está ubicado muy lejos de la zona donde ella reside.   

Ella tiene la experiencia de trabajar en la prestación de servicio de molino como 20 años, esta experiencia la obtuvo por parte de su familia; sus padres trabajaban en su casa de esa forma y desde entonces adquirió el conocimiento. Se casó y luego en su casa puso el molino desde entonces trabaja en eso.

El molino lo compro en la ciudad y cuando le realiza el  mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo, los utensilio y repuestos que necesita los compra en una ferretería donde adquiero el molino, para así poder tener la maquina en buen estado.   


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar él motor eléctrico que mueve él molino, ya que el que tenia  se le fundió;  luego comprara unas bielas que necesita que son para del molino que están ubicada dentro de la estructura.   

Ella menciona que primeo Dios, lograra cancelar este crédito, para solicitar otro en un futuro, ya que ella menciona también que por la oportunidad que se le brindo seguirá trabajando con la fundación campo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old. Her family is comprised of her husband and five children who are already married. Four of her children are in the U.S. and one is with her, a young man who's married and in the workforce. He works as a bricklayer and drives his own car. She provides services in her village by using the mill she has in her house, since there are only two people who own mills in the area where she lives - one of them is her and the other one is a gentleman who lives very far away from that area.

She has 20 years of experience providing milling services, which she got from her family; her parents did this kind of work in their home and from then on she learned the trade. She got married and soon her husband set up the mill in their house, and she has been in this line of work ever since.

She bought the mill in town and when she does preventive maintenance and repair work on it, she buys the supplies and parts she needs at the hardware store where she got the mill, so she can keep the machine in good condition.

The loan she's requesting is to purchase the electric motor that powers the mill, since the one she had melted down; she'll also purchase some connecting rods she needs for the mill that go into the mechanism.

She mentions that, God willing, she'll be able to repay this loan so she can request another one later on. She also mentions that because of the opportunity she was granted, she'll continue to work with Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to purchase the electric motor that powers the mill and also connecting rods that go into the mechanism of the mill.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de rocoto relleno,la socia prepara este plato y lo lleva a vender en forma ambulatoria,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como rocoto,carne,huevos y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot is still in the stuffed pepper sales business. She makes this dish and then sells it on the streets. She has been in this line of work for several years and she does very well. Her dream is to own a restaurant. The member requests this loan in order to purchase cooking supplies such as rocoto peppers, meat, eggs and vegetables.

The member is pleased with the loan and she pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies such as rocoto peppers, meat, eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Armida De Jesús

texts.es:
Armida  de 49 años, estudio hasta séptimo grado de educación básica. Desde hace unos 8 años, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es madre de cuatro hijos; pero solo dos hijas viven con ella ya que Armida es viuda.  

Armida trabaja en lo domestico, en una casa vecina cuidando unos niños,  también tiene un aparato de cargar baterías de carro.  se ha dedicado a esto desde hace 4 años, el trabajo de cuidar las niñas está a 5 minutos  de su casa y en la casa de donde ella vive tiene el aparato para cargar baterías y a esto le ayudan sus hijas cuando regresan de la escuela

El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar  un carretón para la venta de comida rápida; ya que vive en una zona donde hay mucha gente y debido a eso quiere poner ese negocio en la casa.  El préstamo mejorara,  sus ingresos a la casa y así obtendrá  ganancias para sus hijas.

Su objetivo, es sacar adelante a sus  hijas, que  no les falte el alimento en la casa y brindarles una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Armida  is 49 years old, studied up to the seventh grade in school. From 8 years old she has been doing domestic work. She is the mother of four children, but only two daughters live with her. Armida is a widow.

Armida works as a domestic employee taking care of the children in a neighboring house. She also has a apparatus to charge car batteries. She has been working as a domestic for 4 years, and the job taking care of the children is 5 minutes from her house. At her home where she lives she has the apparatus to charge batteries and her daughters help with this when they come home from school.

She seeks a loan to buy a cart to sell her fast food. She lives in an area where there are a lot of people and therefore she wants to open this business in her house. The loan will improve her income at home an in this way she will obtain income to support her daughters.

Her goal is to help her daughters become successful, make sure they do not lack food at home and provide them a university-level education.

loans.use: to buy a small cart to sell her fast food.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Calvario S.b Group

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Santa Bárbara. Siempre se a dedicado al cultivo de granos básico y café. Hace 7 años decidió vender ropa de segunda como(camisas, jeans, short, blusas, ropa de niños, etc.)y también calzado para damas. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener siempre una actividad de negocio. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo ha solicitado en forma grupal, con el cual va invertir en la compra de un fardo de ropa usada para vender y poder aumentar sus ingresos. ella piensa invertir las ganancias en el mantenimiento de la finca de café.
El grupo al que pertenece se llama Mujeres del Calvario S.B, lo integran María y Clementina, en la foto a la derecha esta María de blusa Color blanco y la de blusa Color Morado es doña Clementina, las dos viven es la misma comunidad y se dedican al comercio y agricultura. El préstamo que solicitan grupal es por 8,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa de segunda y vender.
texts.en:
Doña María is 38-years-old, is married, has three children, and lives in the town of Santa Barbara. She has always dedicated herself to the cultivation of basic grains and coffee. Seven years ago, she decided to sell secondhand clothing such as shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, children's clothing, etc. as well as footwear for ladies. She has requested several loans to keep this business activity ongoing. Her loan request is for 5,000 Lempiras and she has applied for this loan as part of a group. She will invest in buying a bundle of used clothing to sell in order to increase her income. She intends to invest the profits in the maintenance of her coffee farm. 

The group to which she belongs is called Mujeres del Calvario S.B, which includes María and Clementina. In the right of the photo wearing the white blouse is María and the woman in the purple blouse is Doña Clementina. Both live in the same community and are both engaged in selling and agriculture. The group loan they are requesting is for 8,000 Lempiras to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of secondhand clothing such as jeans, shirts, blouses, shorts, skirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize and garden eggs in Apaa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 25 years. Efua is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of maize and garden eggs. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits in her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of maize and garden eggs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba en el distrito de Huancarani dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de Artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos en base de lana de alpaca y oveja, ella fabrica chompas, chalinas, mantas, guantes, medias, faldas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana, él  agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. El cliente pertenece al banco comunal “Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba”  y sus reuniones son cada treinta días en la casa de uno de los clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the community of Huayllabamba in Huancarani district, Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Her principal economic activity is the elaboration of artisan goods, such as, for example, textiles made of alpaca and sheep's wool. She makes sweaters, scarves, blankets, gloves, hose, skirts, and other items. 

On this occasion, Lucia is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her work such as, for example, wool. She appreciates and values the loan and is committed to comply with her monthly payments with much responsibility.

Lucia belongs to the “Panty Tikas de Huayllabamba” Communal Bank and their reunions occur each 30 days in a member's house.

loans.use: to buy materials for her work; for example, wool.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de repuestos automoviles,el socio vende pernos,llantas,frenos etre otros,el socio ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de repuestos.El socio solicita le credito para comprar llantas,pernos y frenos.

El socio esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner is still devoted to the business of selling automobile parts. The partner sells bolts, wheels, brakes, and other parts. He has done this work for several years and is doing very well. He works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Through this business, he is able to move forward with his family. His dream is to expand his business of selling spare parts. This partner has requested a loan to buy tires, bolts, and brakes. 

This member is happy with the credit and promises to fulfill all of his scheduled repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires, bolts, and brakes.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 55, has been dealing in the business of milk-selling for many years. She has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously, she took out a loan to purchase a cow. At present, she has 3 milk cows. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of seven and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her life.

Naseem requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the cows. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to have an increase in production capacity of milk, which would ultimately help her in generating more cash to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the cows.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu, 30, stopped her education in the 10th grade. She lives together with her friend in the Paynesville South community. She is a hardworking mother with two children, ages 2 and 16. Only one of them attends school.

For the past 10 years, Bendu has been selling body cream, body powder, body wash, both men's and women's spray, hair grease, and hand cream. Bendu learned to sell from her friend. She makes a profit when she sells because she has many customers. She uses the profits to buy more goods and to support her children. She sells from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and she is grateful to the lenders for empowering her in her business.

She is requesting her fourth loan to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, and women's and men's spray for the business. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, and women's and men's spray for the business.

loans.name: Hebert Danilo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal BATAN ORCCO, el socio Hebert tiene 31 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades con el negocio de elaboración de pasteles ,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio elabora diferentes tipos de pasteles para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca, azucar entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Batan Orcco communal bank.  Hebert, age 31, has one child and is single.  He alternates his activities with the business of making cakes.  He has been in this business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day.  He makes different types of cakes to later sells to his customers who request them.

The member wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this manner.    He is requesting the loan to buy supplies like flour, shortening, and sugar, among others.  He is grateful for the loan that was granted, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established time-frame.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, shortening, and sugar, among others.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is from the village of Ruisi. She is 45 years old and married with a grown son. Her retired mother-in-law lives with her family as well. The family has only seasonal income from agricultural activities: they have a small piece of land where tomatoes are grown for selling. The harvests are sold locally.

Mary and her family members live in poverty and hardly cover food and daily expenses. That is the reason why Mary decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Mary will produce cheese to sell and for family consumtion. Part of the loan will be used for purchasing hay for feeding the cow. The well-fed cow will give the family the expected amount of milk. This loan will be a great support for Mary’s family, as it will generate income. Mary hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and feed for it

loans.name: Rene Wildon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de auto partes y adornos de autos,el socio vende a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de faros, bujías entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Todos Unidos communal bank.  He continues in his business of selling auto parts and auto accessories.  He sells to his customers who request from him.  He has been in this business for years.  It is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day.  He wishes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this manner.

He is requesting to loan to buy headlights and spark plugs, among others.  He is grateful for the loan that was granted, and he pledges to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy headlamps and spark plugs, among others.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. De 36 años de edad, casado y padre de tres  hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de zapatos usados. Inicio su negocio con 5 pares de zapatos, los cuales los vendió muy rápido, luego poco a poco fue invirtiendo lo cual fue rentable y eso lo motivo a establecer su negocio, lleva cinco años dedicándose a esta actividad. Lo apoya su esposa quien lo ayudo con las ventas. Estima que este crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que les ofrecerá variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejor calidad de vida a su esposa e hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: pacas de zapatos con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener mayores ingresos. Su meta próxima es vender toda su mercadería y expandirse a los diferentes departamentos del país. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en: Carlos is from the city of Estelí. He is 36 years old, married and the father of three children. He is a merchant by profession, and he works selling used shoes. He started his business with 5 pairs of shoes, which he sold very quickly. Later, he invested little by little and made a profit, which motivated him to establish his business. He has been doing this work for five years. He receives support in his work from his wife, who helps him with the sales. He believes that this loan will be of great help to him, since he will be able to offer a variety of products to his customers and a better quality of life to his wife and children. He is requesting the loan to buy bundles of shoes with the aim of satisfying his customers' needs and obtaining a higher income. His goal for the near future is to sell all of his merchandise and expand into the various regions of the country. His long-term plan is to improve the infrastructure of his home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of shoes.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 27 years old and lives in Paynesville. She finished high school and lives with her boyfriend who is a construction contractor. They have one five-year old child that lives with them. 

For three years now Annie has been selling cosmetics. She buys them in bulk by carton and says sometimes the cosmetics are not very good, quality varies and there's a chance of losing money. To start her business she took out the savings that she had through a savings club and purchased her first carton of cosmetics to sell. 

Annie has requested a loan to buy more cosmetics by carton for her business. In the future, she wants her child to finish school.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his weed eater.

loans.name: Delmira

texts.es: Delmira tiene 43 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, vive en su propia casa acompañada de su esposo y sus hijos. Delmira es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, años atrás con sus padres y ahora con su esposo, sus principales productos son el fréjol, plátano y yuca, en tiempos de cosecha sacan los productos a la ciudad para comercializarlo, hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, fue su mamá quien le dio la iniciativa de incorporarse en ese negocio. Al principio se le dificultaron las cosas, por que, el mal tiempo les hizo perder su cosecha y se quedaron sin liquidez económica por lo que tuvieron que empezar nuevamente, pero gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo que pudo salir adelante y tener un negocio estable que le genera utilidades, como otro ingreso también se dedica a la venta de asaditos por las tardes en la vereda de su casa. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido, y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y a la reunión del grupo. El dinero solicitado de S/.2000.00 lo invertirá en abono orgánico para mejorar sus cultivos y quitar algunas plantas de sus terrenos.
texts.en: Delmira is 43 years old and is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family.  She lives in her own home along with her husband and children.  Delmira works in agriculture.  She began many years ago with her parents and now works with her husband.  Their main products are beans, plantains and yucca. At harvest they take their products to the market for sale.  She has been working in this field for five years.  It was her mother who gave her the push to begin working in this field.  At first circumstances were difficult because bad weather made them lose their crop and they were left without any income or cash flow.  They had to start all over.
