Thanks to God and to their hard work they have been able to move forward and have a stable business that generates income.  As an additional source of income Delmira works selling grilled foods in the afternoon from the sidewalk in front of her house. This is the first loan that she is requesting through Kiva.  She is very grateful for the economic support that she has received, and she promises to be punctual in her repayments and at group meetings.  She is asking for 2000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) and she will invest the money in organic fertilizers in order to improve her fields and to kill some weeds on her land.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to local neighbours. She appreciates the previous loan that helped her to boost her business. 

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000; she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 45 años, estudio solo primer grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al destazo de cerdos,  junto con él tienen cinco hijos,  lo cual viven en su casa, cuatro de ellos van a la escuela y uno que le ayuda en lo quehaceres  de la casa;  por lo tanto son ellos los que dependen de él.


Él se dedica al destazo de cerdos, este oficio lo hace desde hace dos años.  Antes solo compraba los cerdos y los vendía,  pero un amigo le enseño a destazar; también realiza trabajos agrícolas en los tiempos libres, cuando se normaliza la venta de cerdo, él cultiva maíz y frijoles.

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas cerdo para el destazo y también comprara pollos de engorde; para cuando sea la época de navidad ya estén listo de destazarlos y así poder venderlos. Con el crédito, obtendrá mas ganancias para su familia y así salir adelante 
 
Los sueños son tener una granja de cerdos y de pollos, para venderlos cuando estén grandes o si buscan los clientes así pequeños también venderlos y así darle empleo a los amigos que no lo tengan,  porque si ya salen a vender carne ya es una fuente de ingreso para otras familias .
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old. He studied only through the first grade. He is married, and his wife dedicates herself to the domestic chores and also works butchering pigs. Together they have five children, who live in their home. Four of them go to school, and one helps them with the chores at home. Thus these are the people who depend on Jorge. 

He works butchering pigs. He has done this work for two years. Earlier, he only bought and sold the pigs, but a friend taught him how to butcher them. He also does agricultural work in his free time, when the sale of pork is steady. He cultivates corn and beans. 

The loan he is requesting from the Campo Foundation is to buy more pigs to butcher, and he will also buy chickens to fatten up. He is planning for the Christmas season, when they will be ready to butcher and he will be able to sell them. With the loan he will obtain more earnings for his family and thus get ahead. 

His dreams are to have a pig and poultry farm, to sell the animals when they are grown, or to sell them to customers who want to buy them when they are small. In this way he would be able to provide jobs to friends who do not have work, because if they go out to sell the meat, that would be a source of income for other families.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to butcher as well as chickens to raise.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La socia Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos”, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio  de venta de auto partes, la socia cuenta con un pequeño local por el centro de la ciudad donde vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socias solicito el crédito para la compra de bujias, faros entre otros para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the communal bank “Todos Unidos” ["Everyone United"]. This member continues to dedicate herself to selling auto parts. She has a small shop in the city center, where she sells her merchandise to her customers who order it. She works together with her husband. She has spent quite a lot of time working in this business, which is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. She would like to continue working in order to keep supporting her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy spark plugs, headlights and other merchandise for her business. She feels grateful for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to fulfilling her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, headlights, and other merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Intissar

texts.en:
Intissar is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. She has been working in selling clothes for the past 3 years. She started her business with eagerness, as her aim was to collect an adequate income, in cooperation with her husband who owns a poultry shop, to be able to satisfy the family’s needs.

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase a wide variety of clothes designed to protect persons from the cold. In the future, she plans to open her own store next to her house and sell women's shoes as well.

loans.use: purchase a wide variety of clothes

loans.name: Las Amistosas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina ella es casada tiene 57 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pan, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de panes para luego venderlos en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca, azucar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos secos, venta de bebidas y negocio de venta de papa.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank “Las Amistosas,” which is located in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco. Mrs. Paulina is 57-years-old, married, and has two kids. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling bread. She makes different types of bread and then sells them at one of the markets in the area. She has spent a good amount of time with her business which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wishes to continue working in this way so that she can keep supporting her family. She is applying for a loan so that she can purchase supplies such as flour, butter, and sugar, among other things.

The other bank members have a wide range of work such as selling food, animal husbandry, selling groceries, selling dry goods, drinks, and potatoes. The member who shot the featured photo asked permission to come later to the meeting because of his job.

Mrs. Paulina thanks all those supporting her dream through Kiva and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, butter, sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Armavir town where he lives with his wife and two little children (ages eight and six). 

He has been providing welding services to locals for ten years. In order to overcome financial hardships, Artur is also making entry doors for apartments and houses. 

Over these ten years of hard and tireless work, Artur has gained a good reputation among locals who value his high quality and devoted work. Now, to be able to serve more clients, Artur needs tools and equipment specified for his work. His current tools are in defective condition, so he requests this loan to enable him to purchase the tools and equipment he needs.

Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Artur to be able to continue his business and provide better living conditions for his beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment to provide welding services

loans.name: Carla Patrcia

texts.es: Carla Patricia mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por el comercio, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa tanto para niños como adultos bolsos, pantalones, chineria, cosméticos, shampoo, zapatos entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en diferentes mercados, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales su forma de trabajo es ambulante y en su domicilio, ella desde muy temprano sale de su hogar a distribuir su mercadería a sus clientes, la mayor parte de su mercadearía se encuentra en cuentas por cobrar ya que casi no mantiene mercadería en su negocio, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su vivienda brindando un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos,  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia is an adult woman who is married with two young children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, a zone which is characterized by its commerce and is where one of the country's largest sugar factories is located. She sells general merchandise including a variety of styles of clothing for both children and adults such as purses, pants and shoes; cosmetics and shampoo; and other nicknacks. She sells from home or by foot, in which case she leaves very early from her home to distribute merchandise to her customers. She makes her purchases with cash at various markets and sells for either cash or credit both to returning and one-time customers.  Because she sells most of her merchandise by credit she has a very high turnover of goods.

One of Carla Patricia's dreams is to finish construction on her home, which will give her children a dignified place to live. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with merchandise so that in the not-so-distant future she may increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as: clothing for adults and children, shoes, cosmetics and other nicknacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil is a 70-year-old retired man from the Lagodekhi District, East Georgia. He lives with his wife. The only source of income for the couple is their monthly retirement pensions. The family funds hardly cover feeding and daily expenses and that is why Emil decided to start the business. He believes in his enthusiasm and thinks that he is still able to earn a good income. Emil is applying the loan to start up a bakery in his district and bake traditional Georgian bread--shoti. Part of the loan will be used to purchase basic groceries for starting up a small grocery store. 

Emil and his wife will work hard and generate income for increasing turnover gradually. Emil is happy for this startup loan that is offered to poor people to improve living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start a bakery and a small grocery store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 45 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She has five children; the last child is 14 and the first child is 32. She’s the only source of income for her little family since her husband has not yet started work.

She has been in the water business for six years now. Although during the rainy season she sells less water, with strong determination she knows she will become a success one day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of water for her business and she hopes to open a shop in the nearest future to come.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of water for her business

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquimides de 44 años,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es casado;  su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cinco hijos.

Se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años,  este trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo que lo invitaba a que trabajar como ayudante y así aprendió el trabajo y lo ha seguido haciendo;  pero también don Arquimides, por las tardes al salir del trabajo se dedica a la agricultura,  posee 3,500 metros cuadrados  de milpa y 3,500 de frijoles en el trabajo de la agricultura le ayuda su esposa y las hijas cuando regresan de estudiar.

Con el préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono para la milpa y para los frijoles. El préstamo le mejorara mucho,  ya que con el abono que compre la milpa se seguirá desarrollando y eso implica más ganancias a la hora de venderlo y le queda para el consumo también.

Sus sueños,  es poder ayudar a sus hijos que terminen los estudios y tener maíz para que no falte la tortilla en la casa, ni la comida. Con las ganancias que obtenga de esta cosecha,  sembrara más el próximo año y así poder tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Arquimedes is 44 years old, married and has five children. His wife is a stay at home mom. Arquimedes never had the chance to go to school, but has worked as a bricklayer for the past ten years. He learned this trade from a friend who invited him to work as an assistant and he has done this work ever since. When he finishes bricklaying in the afternoon, Arquimedes then goes to work in his fields. He owns 7,000 square meters of land. He plants beans on one half of this land and plants the other half with a mix of crops. His wife helps with the agricultural work and so do his daughters when they return from school.

The loan he has requested from Fundación Campo will be used to purchase fertilizer for the crops. The loan will really improve his situation because the fertilizer will help the plants develop which means that he will get a better price when he sells them. It will also means that he has enough produce left over to eat.

Arquimedes dreams of being able to help his children finish their studies. He also dreams of having enough food, including corn for tortillas, so that his children are never lacking. With the earnings from this harvest he will invest in planting more next year so that he will have greater earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy responsable, vive en su propia casa acompañada de su esposo y su hija. Su principal actividad económica se centra en el comercio, hace mas de 5 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de mercería, tales como, venta de carteras, joyas, etc. Se inicio en esta actividad viéndose en la necesidad de generar un nuevo ingreso para cooperar con los gastos del hogar y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, hace poco inicio un nuevo negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo. Como una mujer emprendedora Julia espera salir adelante y hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor producto y de calidad. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para implementar su negocio. El dinero solicitado de S/. 700 lo invertirá con la compra de carteras, joyas, maquillaje, entre otros.
texts.en:
Julia is a responsible and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband and daughter. She is a businesswoman. For the past five years she has been selling accessories like wallets, jewels etc. She started this activity seeing the necessity of generating a new income to contribute to the household expenses and to improve the family's quality of living. A little while ago she started a new business selling beauty products, using her home as her work center. As an entrepreneur Julia hopes to progress and expand her small business in order to offer her customers a better high quality product.

This is Julia's first loan with Kiva. She is very grateful for this line of credit which will be very useful in implementing her business. The 700 PEN she has requested will be invested in the purchase of wallets, jewels, make-up etc.

loans.use: to buy wallets, jewels, make-up, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife. He has owned an oven since 2009. He is well known for the delicious pastries that he prepares and for how much people adore his food. 

Today, to get new baking tools and supplies, Ahmad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. We note that Ahmad is ambitious and strives to work very hard to be able to earn a sufficient income to meet life's needs. 

In the future, Ahmad plans to open a bakery in his town and carry on with his work properly.

loans.use: to get new baking tools and supplies

loans.name: Carlos Horacio

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la Ciudad de Estelí. Dueño de un taller de mecánica.  Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito por las oportunidades que le han brindado al otorgarle los créditos ya que atravez de ellos ha logrado todas sus metas propuesta. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar un soldador eléctrico con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus  clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mayores ingresos y mejorar  su calidad de vida. Su meta próxima es comprar más herramientas de trabajo y su plan futuro es mejorar y ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is a native of the city of Estelí. He owns a mechanic’s shop. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrdito for the opportunities provided him through loans which have enabled him to achieve all of his proposed goals.  He is applying for this new loan in order to purchase an electric soldering iron so that he can provide better service to his customers. He believes that the loan will be a great help because he will earn more and improve his quality of life.

His next goal is to purchase more work tools and his future plan is to improve and expand the infrastructure of his business so that his customers will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase an electric soldering iron.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 29-year-old Lebanese single woman. She has worked as a private instructor since 2009. She is very talented at giving lessons on computers and any other related subjects. She receives her students at her house. With her youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, Layal will equip a specific room in her house with needed supplies as the education year is on the point of getting started and must be arranged to welcome students properly. In the future, she hopes to be able to work at an appropriate local school.

loans.use: to equip a specific room in her house with needed supplies

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  no estudio solo se ha dedicado a los domestico, es casada;  el esposo ya es jubilado, procrearon tres hijos que se encuentran casados.   

Ella vende verdura y frutas, de manera ambulante en canastos; este negocio lo hace desde hace dos años. Lo aprendió sola viendo la necesidad de que en la comunidad no pasaban vendiendo frutas y verduras por los hogares, este trabajo lo hace sola por las tardes cuando la hora está fresca.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más fruta y verdura, como: chile, guineos, zanahorias, papas, guïsguiles,  todo lo necesario que se ocupa para que las familias lo disfruten.  Lo que ella vende en la zona,  mejorara sus ingresos.  

Su sueño es tener los clientes satisfechos y que le puedan ir a comprar a la casa, cuando ella ya no pueda salir a vender de casa en casa.
texts.en:
Maria, 52, has never studied and has only devoted herself to the household. She is married, her husband is already retired, and they have had three children who are married.

She sells vegetables and fruits from baskets as an ambulant vendor. She has done this business for two years. She learned of this work by seeing the need in the community where no one went selling fruit and vegetables house-to-house. She only does this work in the evenings when the weather is cool. 

She is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy more fruits and vegetables such as chilis, bananas, carrots, potatoes, pear squash, and everything that the families will enjoy. What she can sell in the area improves her income.

Her dream is to have satisfied customers so that she can go buy a house to have  when she can no longer go out to sell house-to-house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables such as chilis, bananas, carrots, potatoes, and pear squash.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is 50 years old and he lives in Kapan city. Sergey is married and he has two daughters. Both of them are already students at the Kapan State Polytechnic Institute in different departments. Sergey also has higher education and he has a specialty of builder. At this moment Sergey works at the Kapan city Mining and Mineral Processing Plant as a driver. Since he has shift work, on his days off he gives taxi service with his own car. Sergey is the only employed person in his family and apart from the fact that he covers all the needs of his family he also has one more very important duty, to pay for his daughters' tuition fees, which is just impossible to manage no matter how hard he works. 

Sergey is asking for a loan of 260,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his second daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for his second daughter’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en: Nzingo appreciates the support for her previous loan that enabled her to boost her cafe and soap business. Here, again, she comes to you for another loan of 40,000 KES to purchase soap detergents and food products for her business. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase soap detergents and food products for her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks such as beer, water, spirits and soda. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of beer, soda and spirits to sell, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and improve the family standards of living. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another plot of land. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens to sell, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and improve on the facing of the poultry farm. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to sell,

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad, vive en su casa propia acompañada de su esposo y sus 03 hijos, es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy responsable. María se dedica a la venta de comida durante el día y por las tardes a la venta de parrillas, a las afueras de su casa. Hace más de cinco años que viene dedicándose a este negocio, buscando la forma de captar nuevos ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, fue su mamá quien la incursiono en este rubro, ya que tenía bastante experiencia en la venta de comida. Y es así que de la mano de mamá se inicio con el negocio, poco a poco fue creciendo y obteniendo clientes que gustaba de su comida. Al poco tiempo María sufre una gran perdida, la muerte de su mamá, hecho que la deprimió bastante por el cual descuida un poco el negocio. Pero gracias al apoyo de su familia que estuvo en todo momento con ella, es que pudo salir adelante y sacar a delante su negocio. María espera seguir creciendo y abrir un restaurante en la misma ciudad, para mejorar sus ingresos y así mismo su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, con el cual esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido, y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado de S/.2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de madera, clavos , entre otros materiales para arreglar su puesto de venta, ya que dicho negocio se encuentra en las afueras de su casa (al aire libre).
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and lives in her own home accompanied by her husband and three children. She is a responsible and hard-working woman. María sells food during the day and barbeque in the evening, outside her house. She started doing this five years ago, looking for a way to generate new income to raise her family's standard of living. It was her mother that suggested this field as she had lots of experience in selling food. Thus mother's helping hand initiated the business and little by little it grew and gained clients who liked the food. Shortly after María suffered a great loss. Her mother died. María was quite depressed and didn't take good care of the business. But thanks to the support she had at all times from her family, she was able to move ahead and get the business going. Maria hopes to continue to expand and open a restaurant in the same city. She hopes to increase her revenues and raise the quality of living of her family. 

This is María's first loan with Kiva. She is very grateful for the financial support and promises to pay her installments on time. She has requested 2,000 PEN which will be invested purchasing wood, nails and other materials to fix up her sales stand, given that it is located outside her house (in the open air).

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Alex De Jesús

texts.es:
Alex de 30 años,  estudio hasta octavo grado, es casado;  su esposa se dedica a la elaboración  de flores artificiales, este negocio lo hace en las casa,  tiene tres hijos (7, 3 años de edad y la recién nacida de un mes). 

Alex trabaja en un hotel como ordenanza,  tiene un año de dedicarse a ese trabajo un amigo lo motivo a buscar ese empleo y quedo trabajando. Ahí, tiene un turno de 48 horas y en los días libres le ayuda a la esposa a elaborar las flores.

El préstamo que está solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más material para elaborar las flores, como: papel y colorante para teñir el papel, el negocio mejorara el estilo de vida; ya que con el negocio hay más fuente de ingresos para su familia y lo que satisfará es que ya podrá elaborar más flores y así les venderá a todo los clientes que las busquen.

El sueño de su vida es sacar adelante a sus  hijos y así no sufran de la comida y tenerles el alimento en casa y también es seguir con su trabajo y tener ganancias,  cuando sus  hijas crezcan poder enviarlas a estudiar .
texts.en:
Alex, 30, has an 8th grade education. He is married and his wife works making artificial flowers. This business is done in the house. They have three children (7, 3, and a newborn who is one-month-old). 

Alex works in a hotel as an administrative assistant. He has done this work for a year. A friend motivated him to seek this job and he has kept working. There he works 48-hour shifts and on off-days he helps his wife make the flowers. 

The loan they are seeking at Fundación Campo is for buying more materials to make flowers such as paper and dye to color the paper. The business has improved their lifestyle because the business is another source of income for the family. It would pay off to be able to make more flowers and sell them to all of the clients who seek them.

His ultimate dream is to raise his children so that they do not suffer from hunger and have food for them at home. He also wants to continue with their work and make a profit to send their daughters to school when when they are older.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make flowers such as paper and dye to color the paper.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Ширингул добросовестная женщина. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. Ширингул на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж водитель. Ширингул более 4 лет работает в лицее поваром. Она замечательный повар. Все студенты любят ее, так как она готовит вкусно. Ширингул и ее семья живут бедно. Она выдала замуж свою дочь, и она должна скоро провести ее свадебное торжество. Она не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы провести ее свадебное торжество. Ширингул запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Этот займ поможет ей сделать счастливой ее дочь, и таким образом создать еще одну семью в Таджикистане. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shiringul is a conscientious woman of 49. She is married and raising four children. Shiringul's husband is a driver and she has been working as a cook in a school for more than four years. She is a wonderful cook, and all the students love her since she prepares delicious food. 

Shiringul and her family live poorly. Her daughter is now engaged to be married and Shiringul will soon need to hold her wedding celebration, but she doesn't have enough money to put the event on. She is requesting a loan of 4,500 somoni for the wedding. This loan will help her to make her daughter happy and in such a way to create one more family in Tajikistan. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol, 33 years old, is a noble man and married with three school-aged children. He lives with his wife and children in a small village of Baray district, Kampong Chhnang province. To earn a living, he has been involved in a fishing business for 8 years. Every day he goes fishing along the Tonle Sap River and sells caught fish at the shore, where local traders usually come to collect fish to sell into the markets of the province. From this business, he is able to make a net profit of KHR 15,000 per day to cover his daily costs. 

The house he lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation to keep his family living comfortably. Due to insufficient money, he has applied for a loan of KHR 2,400,000 to buy construction materials needed for his home improvement and to pay for labor costs. He hopes to provide his family a warm place to live in without worrying about the coming rainy season and bad weather conditions. 

Thanks to the lenders for this constant support.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed for his home improvement and pay for labor costs as well.

loans.name: Isabel Lucia

texts.es:
Isabel es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, negocio  con el cual puede obtener ingresos para poder salir adelante, Isabel cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es ordenada, responsable y siempre atiende bien a sus clientes.

Isabel agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como abarrotes, productos de bazar como adornos, portarretratos, entre otros; con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad de productos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y sus ingresos mejoren, así podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman who is eager to succeed. Consequently, through a great deal of effort, she was able to start her business selling groceries and drinks. The business enables her to earn a living so that she can move forward. Isabel believes that her business is doing well because she is well organized, responsible and always provides her customers with good service.

Isabel is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are providing her because, thanks to that help she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business, such as groceries, stationary products like decorations, and picture frames, among other items. Therefore, she will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers and her income will improve. Thus she can continue struggling to make her great dream a reality: that of owning her own mini market.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (groceries, stationary products and other items).

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his tailoring.  He does tailoring and sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes to sell. It will help Richard to generate greater profits and improve more on his business. 

Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to own a textile manufacturer. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes to sell,

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor lives with his family in the village of Goght in the Kotayq region. He is married and has two children. His daughter is engaged and soon to be married, and his son is attending school.

Grigor has a nice orchard with apple, plum, peach and pear trees which bear rich and sweet fruit. He also has several nut trees. Grigor sells his harvest at the local wholesale market. Using mulberries, his wife makes sujukh, a popular Armenian sweet in which threaded walnuts are dipped in a syrup spiced with cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, etc., then dried. It sells out very quickly to local children and visitors to the village.

While he has his orchard, Grigor would like to start raising cattle. He is applying for a 700,000 AMD loan through Nor Horizon to build a barn and buy cattle. He would like to make more money for his family through this venture.

loans.use: to build a barn and buy cattle.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Moa is 60 years old and the single mother of four grown-up children. She currently lives with her two single children in her own house in Kandal province, while the other two have settled down for marriage already. 

To make a livelihood, she is in the business of restoring clothes from her home, raising fish in a pond, and also making and selling fermented fish paste ("prahok" in Khmer) during the shallow-water season of the year for additional income.

With the loan she has requested from HKL, she aims to invest in the purchase of salt and small fish for making fermented fish. Also she will use the remaining balance to buy feed for fattening her fish. 

She believes that she will make a good profit from this investment as she strives to work hard. She thanks lenders for this constant support, awaits your kindness, and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase salt and small fish for making fermented fish.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
Arshak and his nice family live in Vanadzor city. Arshak graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical University Historical-Juridical department. Now he works at the Vanadzor city branch of gasification office as a Legal Advisor. Arshak is married and he has two sons.  His elder son studies at  Yerevan State University at the paid division and his second son is still school-aged. Arshak’s wife works at the school as a teacher, but together Arshak and his wife barely manage to cover all their family needs and cumulative expenses and now they are unable to pay for their son’s education. 

Arshak is seeking a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with five children and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more dryers, a washing sink, cream relaxers, braids and weaves. She generates additional income from renting rooms.  She works in her shop  and sells both retail and wholesale seven days out of every week.  

Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and on-and-off electricity.  She aspires to own a big beauty salon and also to build more rental rooms.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair dryers, a washing sink, braids, cream relaxers and weaves

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in the city of Vedi, which is in Ararat region. He is 37 years old and married, and he lives with his wife and three school-aged children. 

For many years Artur worked at a furniture workshop in Yerevan city, but since 2010 he began his own business in the city of Vedy. Now he has a small workshop of his own where he takes orders, mainly making kitchen and restroom furniture. 

His workshop is very well known not only in Vedi but also in nearby regions, and that is why he has many loyal clients who want to order their desired style of furniture particularly at his workshop.  

Artur asks a loan of US$ 2,800 dollars in order to buy a lot of raw materials for his work.  He has many orders and he must fill them on time, but he lacks materials, which makes his work slow and not productive.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his work, since he has many orders he must manage to do on time

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his hair-dressing salon. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair weaves and other hair styles for the salon to attract more clients, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and provide medicale care for his chidren. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger salon. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair weaves and other hair styles for the salon to attract more clients.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with five children and all her children go school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and mother). 

She has a restaurant business, and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, cassava and charcoal. Oliver generates additional income from selling water and cold drinks. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

Oliver aspires of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, cassava and charcoal.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with five children, all of whom go to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina has operated a juice-making business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

With the 20,000 KES (Kenya shillings) loan, she wants to purchase sacks of passion fruit, carrots, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of passion fruit, carrots, and sugar for her business

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth is 41 years old and is a married woman with four children. She lives in her own home in Bakan district of Pursat province, which is located in the western part of the country. To earn a living, she and her husband manage a rice farming business on approximately two-hectares of farmland. It is the sole source of their income. They have been in this occupation for more than 20 years. 

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a 1,100 US dollars loan to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine and buy its facilities.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married and has five children: two of whom go to school, two are adults and one is underage. They live in a rental house that has piped water but no electricity.

Saumu has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Hitler

texts.es: Hitler es un hombre muy trabajador y muy responsable, vive en compañía de su esposa y uno de sus hijos, en su casa propia. Su principal actividad es el brindar servicios de pintura y también tiene una máquina, donde diseña las placas para motos y autos,  hace mas de 10 años que viene dedicándose a esta actividad, el cual ya tiene bastante experiencia y un nombre reconocido en el mercado, se inicio en este rubro económico ya que de joven desarrollo un taller dedicado a la pintura y así decidió emprender su propio negocio y gracias al apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos es que salio adelante y sigue vigente en el mercado. Hace un año también se incursiono en el negocio dedicado a la venta de medicina natural, negocio asociado con uno de sus hijos, actividad en el cual le esta yendo muy bien ayudándole a mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida. Como todo hombre emprendedor, Hitler espera que su negocio siga creciendo y sea prospero. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, el cual esta muy agradecido por el apoyo económico recibido prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y a las reuniones con el grupo. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de material para hacer la placas y además comprará medicina natural para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Hitler is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives with his wife and one of his children in his own home. His main activity is offering painting services. He also has a machine with which he designs license plates for motorcycles and cars. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He has a lot of experience and a well known name in the business. He started this economic activity because when he was young he did painting in a workshop and that's how he decided to open his own business. Thanks to his wife's and his children's help he got ahead and is still in the market. A year ago he also got into the business of selling natural medicine, a business associated with one of his children. This activity is going very well for him and helping to improve his income and his quality of life. As an enterprising man, Hitler is hoping for his business to keep growing and being prosperous. This is his first Kiva loan and he is very grateful for the financial support he has received. He promises to make his payments on time and to go to the group meetings. The money he has asked for is S/.1500 nuevos soles. He will invest in buying material to make the plates and also to buy natural medicine to stock his business.

loans.use: to buy license plate making materials and natural medicine.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who attend school. He has been working as a blacksmith since 1990. He is very experienced and has been able to build a good business reputation over the years because of his proficiency. He has two full-time employees.

Today Jamal is applying for a 3,000,000 LBP loan through Kiva’s partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a generator to use in his operations. In the future Jamal’s business plans include venturing into other areas.

loans.use: buy an electrical generator

loans.name: Fawzieh

texts.en:
Fawzieh is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. 

She works at her house where she has set up a room devoted for tutoring. She has been in this business for the past five years. And today, she is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to renovate the room and supply it with required materials and tools to help provide the students with a good education. In the future, Fawzieh wishes to start to work at a local school and earn a good income.

loans.use: to renovate the tutoring room and supply it with required materials and tools.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 46 years old and she lives in Vnadzor city. She has graduated Yerevan State Medical University and now she works at the Vanadzor Health Center as a therapist. Siranush is married and she has three children: two sons and a daughter. Her husband works at the sewing workshop as a chief of the workshop. Their elder son studies at the Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute at the faculty of Radio Communication. Their other two children are still school-aged. 

Siranush and her husband are working very hard with a strong desire to provide good living conditions for all their children. The result of their hardwork is that, after a long period of saving some money, they have managed to buy a small flat in Yerevan city and now their son lives in that flat while he is at the Polytechnic Institute.

Now Siranush asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to improve her son’s living conditions in that flat, where they need to do some reconstruction and also to buy some furniture for the apartment.

loans.use: to improve her son’s living conditions in a flat which they have purchased for him, where they need to do some reconstruction and also to buy some furniture for the apartment

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, age 23, is from Daba Kulashi, a small town in the western part of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, his father and his retired grandmother. George's mother lives and works abroad. She transfers money to her family and these funds are the only income for the family. George has a bachelor's degree in law but he is jobless at the moment.

He is a very energetic young man, who wishes to generate income for the well being of his family members. 

He is requesting the loan to start up an internet cafe in his town. George managed to save some money to purchase needed equipment, but now he needs money to add three personal computers to his cafe. 

George hopes his project will be lucrative especially among youngsters as the  majority of local people still do not have personal computers and access to an internet connection at home. George will earn money and will be able to improve the family's living conditions in the future.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start an internet cafe

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles grew up in a predominantly cattle-keeping family and developed his skills from there. With some cattle given to him by his father, he started breeding and selling young bulls, especially during the dry season when weather was harsh and people were selling cheaply because there is limited feed.

He later made enough money, after he bred them and sold them at high prices, and bought more, expanding his farm and cattle business. The Ugafode loans have also contributed a lot to his expansion. He thanks the Kiva lenders for being interested in partnering with him. He is hard-working and is optimistic his farm will increase with more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Bintinasiri

texts.en:
Bintinasiri lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She is a divorced woman with five children who are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has a store in her house in which she stocks and sells makuti (thatching materials made from palm leaves). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more makuti for resale. She expects to do this without any difficulties, and to continue working without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti for resale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married, and has three school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition,she prepares and sells dumplings.

With the Ksh 10,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Kamandar

texts.en:
Kamandar is from the village of Karajala. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. 

The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. In particular, they grow tomatoes, cucumbers, and beans in the greenhouses and sell the harvested products locally. Besides, he has three milk cows and a calf. Kamandar’s wife produces cheese with the milk for selling. 

Kamandar has Azerbaijanian origins, but his family has lived in Georgia for a long time.  He is a very hard-working man with a strong desire to get more income and ensure his family members better living conditions.

Kamandar has noticed high demand for fish in the market. In response to the local market demand, he has requested credit to finance the costs of cleaning his pond and purchasing local species of fish. Beginning in the spring season, the fish will start to spawn and after a year they can be intensively sold. 

Kamandar expects that development of the fish farm will raise the income of the family. Part of the increase in income will be reinvested in the same business, and the other part will be used for improving the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to clean his pond and start a fish farm

loans.name: Leui

texts.en:
Leui is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Leui has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand his business, Leui has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread to sell, and will help Leui to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Leui hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Leui is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Leui who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items such as sugar, milk and bread to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (a nephew).  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for many years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1200000Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from a retail shop.  She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler of used clothes and also to build rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

In addition to her cashew nut selling business, she prepares chapatti (flat bread). She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of cashew nuts, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes to re-sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Actian

texts.en:
Actian is 29 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single with four children aged between 3 and 12 years old. All four children live at home and attend school. 

For the past five years she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market. Actian learned this business from her parents. Her main challenge is the rainy season. She has requested this loan to buy bags of rice to re-sell. 

In the future, she would like to have her own house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
Baindu is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville; she is married with two children aged 7 and 10. They live at home and attend school. For the last six years she has been selling children's clothes, men's clothes, women's clothes, etc.

Baindu has requested this loan to purchase more clothes. She says her problem is low inventory in the shop. She started this business by helping her mother at a table, so from that point she learned the business. It makes her proud because it helps her to send her children to school. In future she would like to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a married woman with four children, wants to thank Ugafode for how far it has brought her.  Through the use of the Ugafode Micro mortgage loan, she managed to complete her residential house that had stalled for a long time. 

She now wants this loan to buy cattle for trading. She thanks Ugafode for continually supporting her in her journey of getting rich. She hopes with the cows, she will be able to increase her income and also ably meet her family needs. 

She is a hard-working woman who supplements the cattle trading income with selling charcoal. She has also been able to educate her children well.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trading

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 42 years old and lives in Paynesville south. She is married and her husband is a local businessman. They have four children aged between 9 and 21 years old, all of them are presently in school and living at home. 

For the past six years, Oretha has been running a provision shop which sells soap, tissues, chloride, etc. She normally makes a lot of profit, but her major problem is that she has a low inventory, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, chloride, tissues, etc. for her business. She hopes to build her store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, chloride, tissues, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Kabbeh

texts.en:
Kabbeh is 37 years old and live in Paynesville South, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is single and has a 20-year-old child, who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past five years, Kabbeh has been selling palm oil in the local market. She make a lot of profit, and has more and more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Blerim

texts.en:
Blerim is from Kosovo. He is 36 years old, married, and is the father of four children, two of whom go to school. His wife is a housewife, taking care of the children, and Blerim works in construction, building houses and other projects as needed in order to make a living. 

Until now, he was working for a very low salary with a private company, but he has recently decided to open up his own company as he feels confident with all of his experience and established customers. Blerim's work is very important to him as he is the only one in the family who has a job and is able to generate income. He is requesting a loan for the first time, in order to buy a cement machine and other supplies and construction materials needed to start his business. This loan will help him to reach his dream and goal, which is to expand his business and to be self-employed, so that he can give a better future to his family. He is very grateful for this support!

loans.use: to buy a cement machine and construction materials for his start up business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah live in the Paynesville South area. She is 43 years old, and is a widow with three children aged between 8 and 14, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

For the past three years Sarah has been selling pepper, oil, and vita. She started this business with a little amount received from her friend, and learned this way of selling from friends. Her business helps maintain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, and vita for her business. 

In the future, Sarah plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, and vita for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is unmarried and her husband is unemployed. They have two children aged 7 and 13 years old; the children are currently in school and live at home. 

For five years now, Martha has been buying rocks for crushing and re-selling them around the rock hill community. She makes lots of profit and has more customers since her spot is in a very good location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rock for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rock for her business.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
Mamia lives in Paynesville. She is 31 years old, and is married with three children aged between 5 and 19 years old. The children are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past four years, Mamia has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with a small amount of money received from her husband. She says: she enjoys selling to her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to grow her business. In the future she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to grow her business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline live in Paynesville. She is 27 years old, and is single with a 5-year-old child, who is in school.

For the past eight years, Angeline has been selling fashion clothes. She learned this way of selling from her friends and started this business with money given to her by her friend. She likes her business because her business helps her to provide for her child. 

Angeline is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, t-shirts, etc.) for her business. In the future she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
45-year-old Mamie has operated a shop which sells Lappa (fabric) for the past four years now. She makes good profits and has many customers, since she has quality Lappa. 

Mamie is married and lives in the Paynesville area. She has six children aged between 11 and 23. They live at home, and only four of them attend school. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa (fabric) for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is 39 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County.  She is married, and her husband is a businessman.  They have three children, 3 to 10 years old; the children are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past eight years she has been selling used clothes in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. 

Lucky requested a loan of LDR 17,000 LRD loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  Her plans are to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 49 years old and lives in the Paynesville South, a populated area in Montserrado County.  She is married to a doctor and they have 4 children between the ages of 24 and 32 years old.  Only one is in school and living at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling lappa (traditional clothes used by African women) in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit and has more customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase additional lappa for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional lappa for her business.

loans.name: Nohemy Yamileth

texts.es:
Nohemy de 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos.  Ejerce sus oficios domésticos y tiene un nivel académico de 2º grado. También, presta sus servicios en una empresa atunera, empacando mariscos desde hace 7 años.

La experiencia de Nohemy, la adquirió por medio de una amiga, quien le recomendó que en esa empresa le ayudarían a tener un mejor ingreso económico.

Nohemy utilizara el dinero del crédito, para comprar madera y lámina  para el techo,  para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que es necesario; pues las condiciones en las que se encuentra no son muy favorables para el bienestar familiar. 

Nohemy pretende que sus hijos obtengan una buena educación, y mantener  una familia en buenas condiciones de oportunidades de progreso y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Nohemy, 35, is married and has three children. She performs her domestic activities and has an Grade 2 academic level. For the last seven years she has also provided her services in a tuna business, packing seafood.

Nohemy acquired her experience from a friend, who recommended to her that this business would help her to have a better income.

Nohemy will use the money from the loan to buy wood and sheet metal for a roof, for the necessary improvement of her home, since the current conditions are not favorable for the family's well-being.

Nohemy strives for her children to obtain a good education and to maintain her family in good conditions with opportunities for progress and development.

loans.use: to purchase wood and sheet metal for a roof, for the necessary improvement of her home.

loans.name: Josephine K.

texts.en: Josephine is 23 years old and lives in the Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County.  She is single and a university student.  Over the past three years she has been selling slippers in the local market.  She makes a lot of profit and has more customers, which makes her happy about her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Tarapoto junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos, en su casa propia. Ruth es una mujer responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene una ferreteria, siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo, hace mas de 3 años que viene dedicándose a esta actividad junto a su esposo, todo gracias al esfuerzo y esmero que pusieron para llevar a cabo esta ferretería, como todo negocio al principio se le complicaron las cosas, las ventas eran bajas, no tenia muchos clientes, pero ahora puede verse que tiene un negocio estable. Se inicio buscando generar sus propios ingresos para ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y un mejor futuro. Ruth espera que su negocio siga creciendo y prospere con el pasar del tiempo. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo cual esta muy agradecida, ya que le dara el capital para que implemente mas su ferretería, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y asistir a las reuniones del grupo. El dinero solicitado de S/.1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como clavos, martillos, desarmadores, entre otros, para surtir su ferreteria.
texts.en:
Ruth is 28, she lives in the city of Tarapoto with her husband and two children, in their own house. Ruth is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She owns a hardware store located in her own house. She has worked at this enterprise together with her husband for three years thanks to the effort and care that they exerted to bring this hardware store into existence. Like all businesses, at the beginning things were complicated - sales were low, there were not many customers - but now it is evident that she has a stable business.

She began searching to generate her own income in order to provide her children with a good quality of life and a better future. Ruth hopes that her business will continue growing and prospering with the passage of time. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, for which she is very grateful, since this will give her the capital to better implement her hardware store. She promises to be punctual with the payment of her instalments and to attend the group's meetings. She will invest the money requested, 1000 nuevos soles, in the purchase of materials like nails, hammers, screwdrivers, etc. in order to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy materials like nails, hammers, screwdrivers, etc.

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 children.  She lives in West Point and her husband is a carpenter.  Her children are between the ages of 10 and 29.  Three of them attend school, two are independent, and the oldest one is married.  She is currently selling charcoal at the community market after learning from her aunt.  She is proud of her business because she earns her own income and helps her husband with the expenses of the home.  

She is requesting this fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more charcoal for the business.  Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is single and has completed the 12th grade.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells cold water and charcoal.  She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM.  She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  She used a shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  Miatta is requesting a loan to purchase more water sacks and charcoal for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more water and charcoal.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling fish in Funko, near Cape Coast.  She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years.  Cecilia is married and has four children.  Her husband works as a mason.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and towards paying their children’s school fees.  

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus helping her to improve overall sales.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in West Point.  She is 36 years old and married with four children, ages 5 to 19.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Three of her children live with her and attend school.  The other child lives with her sister.  Hawa is presently selling dried fish and fufu, which is dough made from cassava.  She sells children's clothes for both boys and girls to earn a profit.  With the profit she buys goods to improve the business and to help her husband with the family expenses.  She has requested her fourth loan to purchase more dry fish and fufu for the business.  Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and fufu for the business.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha is married and has three children.  Her husband works as a farmer.  Even though Agartha grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream.  This is to achieve a better life for herself and her family.  

Currently, Agartha is an entrepreneur.  She sells clothes and shoes in Funko, near Cape Coast.  Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay for their children’s school fees.  Agartha wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of clothes and shoes.  

In the long term, Argatha plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet the needs of increasing customer demands.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Agartha wants to buck the trend and ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 48 years old and the mother of four children.  She lives in West Point with her husband, who is a driver.  Her children are between the ages of 17 and 29.  She now runs a local restaurant in the market and has been involved in this business for the past 6 years.  Hawa sells for a profit and uses this to improve the business and her life.  She is requesting her fourth loan to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, and oil for the business.  Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase rice, fish, pepper, and oil for her restaurant.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Theresa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bread and fried eggs in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Theresa is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Theresa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread and fried eggs. 

In the long term, Theresa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels,  allowing her to sell greater quantities of bread and fried eggs.

loans.name: Cecila

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecila is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Funko (near Cape Coast). 

Cecila is married and has three children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Cecila will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecila plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a small-scale fishmonger in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle-school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Dorcas has been working as a fishmonger for close to ten years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to increase her inventory, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a fish stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of fish, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is married with three children. She has received some formal education till the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Dorothy sells fish in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about seven years now. 

Her husband is a fisherman. Dorothy’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Dorothy will use the loan to increase her existing stocks of fish. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Dorothy plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing stocks of fish

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris is 49 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is single and has 4 children, ages 12 to 19 years old.  Only three children are in school and two of them live at home.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past three years she has been running a table in the market where she sells items, such as rice, oil, soap, and toothpaste.  She sells six days a week from 7am to 5pm.  She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  She used a taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more items, such as rice, oil, soap, and toothpaste.  She plans to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, soap, and toothpaste for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single without any children.  Although Sarah grew up in difficult circumstances, she is an entrepreneur.  She specializes as a hairdresser in Funko, near Cape Coast.  Sarah has been involved in this enterprise for four years.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her to support herself and her extended family.  Sarah wants to use her loan to upgrade her tools and increase her current inventory levels, thus allowing her to serve her clients better.  In the long term, Sarah plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus expanding to meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to upgrade her hairdresser tools and inventory.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Angelina decided to set up her own fish business in Funko (near Cape Coast). With over three years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more fish for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a chainsaw operator, with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their child is able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Estefania Jeanmillette
