texts.es: Estefanía de 18 años de edad habita en casa familiar junto a su familia.  Es una joven muy trabajadora, responsable  y emprendedora. Se dedica al comercio de ropa para dama y caballero. La venta la realiza en el mercado de su comunidad y  cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más por ofrecer productos de buena calidad y a bajos precios. Su casa de habitación es muy humilde.  Tiene el deseo de mejorar las condiciones de su cuarto el cual está cubierto por plástico y es muy inseguro cuando llueve. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para cambiar las paredes de su habitación.
texts.en: Estefanía is 18 years old and lives with her family.  She is a very hardworking, responsible, and enterprising young woman who sells men's and women's clothing in the community market.  She has many customers because she offers good quality items at low prices.  She has a humble home and wants to make improvements to her room, currently covered with plastic and it is not secure when it rains.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy galvanized metal, nails, and lumber to change the walls in her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 44-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who attend school. In 2000, and after seeing a need to get involved and help her husband to pay the expenses, Amal started to sell clothes from her home. She states that the revenue that she was earning was almost enough and that’s why in 2009, she started to work as a hairdresser as well. Today, Amal wants to concentrate on one profession; to do so, she looks forward to borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase clothes in large quantity to support her business and be able to attract more customers and increase her sales. As for her future plans, Amal intends to open a clothing store as soon as she can.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in large quantity

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a single woman with one child who is still underage. She lives at her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mgeni has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is single and has one child. After successfully graduating from junior high school, Lydia is now an established businesswoman. She sells groceries in Funko (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years.  As the sole breadwinner in the family, Lydia uses her income to provide for the entire family. Lydia will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus helping to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lydia plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yuris Yamileth

texts.es:
Yuris de 24 es una joven que estudio hasta séptimo grado, es casada;  el esposo se dedica al trabajo en una funeraria, tiene una hija de 4 años.

Yuris se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, desde hace 5 años.  Ella lo aprendió de una vecina,  antes trabajaba vendiendo frutas en el mercado; pero luego que se dedicó a este negocio de la semilla y se quedó trabando en esto ya que el negocio de la semilla le queda más ganancias 


El préstamo que está solicitando a  Fundación Campo, es para  comprar  4 medidas de semilla de marañón,  para asarlas y sacarlas a vender en los buses. Al comprar más semilla tendrá más ganancias y pagara sus deudas y saldrá adelante con su familia,  una de las necesidades que serán satisfecha es el ingreso que tendrá cuando venda toda esta semilla y tendrá como comprar más y vender más.

Sus sueños, es en un futuro comprar mucha semilla y asarla, empaquetarla y exportarla a otros países.  También, espera ayudar a su  hija en lo que pueda para que ella cuando empiece los estudio pueda llevar su refrigerio y también así es una forma de motivarla a que siga estudiando y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Yuris is a 24-year-old young woman who attended school up to the seventh grade.  She is married; her husband makes a living at a funeral home.  She has a four-year-old daughter.  Yuris has made a living selling cashew nuts for five years.  She learned this from a neighbor before selling fruit in the market, but later she dedicated herself to the nut business and continued to work in it because the nut business left her more profit.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four measurements of cashew nuts in order to roast them and take to sell on the buses.  Upon buying more nuts she will get more profit, pay her debts, and get her family ahead in life.  One of the needs that will be satisfied is that the income she gets from selling all the nuts she will then have to buy more and sell more.

Her dream for the future is to buy a lot of nuts, roast them, package them, and export them to other countries.  She also hopes to help her daughter as much as possible so that when she begins school she can take refreshments with her; this is also a way to encourage her to keep studying and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy four measurements of cashew nuts in order to roast them and take to sell on the buses.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esperanza is 39-years-old and has three children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. Esperanza has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Romik

texts.en: Romik is a young agronomist from Arshaluys village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, his small son and daughter, his parents, and his brother. To be able to take care of the family's needs, Romik is engaged in the cultivation of wheat, tomato, potato, cucumber, and eggplant with the help of his family members. Plant cultivation is the only source of family's income. Romik and his family members sell the agricultural products in the local market. Currently their agribusiness needs some investments. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working young farmer and his family, and will enable them to purchase cellophane, bottles for the greenhouse, tomato and potato seeds, and fertilizers, and renovate the greenhouse. Romik and his family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their support in collecting the needed loan amount to maintain and improve their agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase cellophane, bottles for the greenhouse, tomato and potato seeds, and fertilizers, and renovate the greenhouse.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is from Vanadzor town where she lives with her mother and grandfather. Karine's mother (in the photo) does not work and her grandmother is a pensioner. So the main income of the family comes from Karine's business. She provides accounting services to local institutions and gathers income, which is vital for her family. Because of the family's poor conditions, Karine is not able to purchase computer, which she needs for her work very much. Therefore, she is asking for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Karine, to purchase a computer that she needs for her work. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for a computer to provide accounting services.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Eva works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food market business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her business. Fely successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Fely's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, spices and other ingredients for her food market business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 63 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, soft-drinks, and other groceries. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is married and she works hard to support her family. 

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from soft-drinks retailing. Melinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, a rural villager from Battambang province's Battamabng district, is 43 years old and she has five children. Four of whom are still in school. Kunthea has been selling Khmer Noodles and she has been engaged in this business for 10 years.

This is the fourteenth-cycle loan for Kunthea with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past business loans, which she successfully repaid, has helped her to sustain her living condition as well as her business in a gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter, an 18-year-old freshman in a local university specializing in Banking and Finance. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university and also helps her daughter to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter's university education.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a poultry-raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and general store businesses. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Vet

texts.en:
Residing in the Kos Krolo District of Battambang Province, Vet is 45 years old and married. She has five sons, three of whom still depend on her and who are still in school. Vet has struggled to make a living through selling grocery items and farming rice. Vet has been engaged in her business for 10 years and is able to earn up to KHR 80,000 per day. However, she is only able to save KHR 40,000 per day after deducting all related expenses.
 
Vet has never been with Kiva's partner VisionFund before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund for an education loan to pay for her son's university fees for four years. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue his degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees for four years.

loans.name: Tegou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TEGOU 2 sont toutes  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Yapama
debout  en première  position de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 47.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Tegou 2 group are all married women who are, on average, 32 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Yapama grows onions, and she is the person standing first from the left. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level and in Bandiagara, to men and women customers. 

Yapama hopes to earn 47,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

Yadiko hopes to earn 23,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme Hawa Hamidou dite Padalou assise en première  position de la droite  vers la gauche sur la photo.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 24000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution.

Hawa Hamidou, who is called Padalou, grows onions, and she is the person seated first on the right in the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level and in Bandiagara, to men and women customers. 

Hawa Hamidou hopes to earn 24,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Iterambere Group

texts.fr:
Elisabeth  fait partie du groupe Iterambere  et  habite à Bubanza. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à  Fulgence,  un  ingénieur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants âgés de 4 a 12 ans  tous étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce du riz  depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kg de riz  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait avoir un logement décent.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a member of the Iterambere group and lives in Bubanza. She is 32 years old and is married to Fulgence, an engineer. Together they have four children, aged four to 12. All the children go to school.

Elisabeth has been selling rice for ten years. This is her first loan with Turame. With this loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy many kilograms of rice that she will resell and earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to have a nice place to live.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Tchotchovi

texts.fr: Tchotchovi est une femme mariée de 39ans à transitaire. Elle a 3 enfants dont le premier a 8ans et le dernier a 1an6mois ; deux sont scolarisés. Elle est couturière et revend des produits de mercerie, des cartes de recharges et divers ; elle exerce son métier depuis 2002. Elle emploie 3 personnes. Elle demande son troisième prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de produit de mercerie, de sachets d’eau, de chaussures, de cartes de recharges et divers et réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle compte avoir son propre local pour vendre plus et en gros puis assurer un avenir radieux pour ses filles.
texts.en:
Tchotchovi is 39 years old and is married to a forwarding agent. She has three children, aged from one and a half years old to eight years old. Two of the children go to school. 

Tchotchovi is a seamstress and resells haberdashery items, mobile recharge cards, and other goods. She has been doing this since 2002. She employs three people.

She is seeking this third loan with WAGES to invest in her business and to buy haberdashery, pouches of water, shoes, phone recharge cards, and other goods.

She plans to have her own place where she can sell more and sell at wholesale, in order to ensure a bright future for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery, mobile recharge cards, etc.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village in the Thmor Koul district, Chanthou is a 49-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of family income are rice farming and seedling mushrooms, which she has been doing for twenty years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 70,000 per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the fourth loan for Chanthou with VisionFund and the group successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for this loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it on labor and land ploughing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 44 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julie has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items, such as retail rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Рамазон ответственный и порядочный мужчина. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Со своей семьёй Рамазон живёт в сельском посёлке. Сам он работает поливальщиком в дехканском хозяйстве. Вся его семья любит трудиться и не сидеть без дела. Жена Рамазона занимается купля продажей молочных продуктов, дочь портниха, работает на дому, шьёт на заказ одежду. Сын Рамазона находится на заработках в России, и получает там хороший доход, который ежемесячно  присылает своим родителям на пропитание. Рамазон также выращивает скот, а потом продаёт мясо и молоко, полученное от этого скота на местном рынке. Вот уже как 2 года Рамазон сотрудничает с Арванд, он брал кредит на расширение своего бизнеса. Сейчас в очередной раз Рамазон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить несколько голов скота для дальнейшего выращивания и продажи. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ramazon is a responsible and respectable man.  He is married with 4 children and lives with his family in a village in the countryside.   Everyone in his family loves to work hard and does their best to avoid being idle.  Ramazon himself works as a waterer on a dehkan farm, while his wife buys and sells dairy products.  His daughter is a seamstress who works from home, sewing clothes to order, and his son is a migrant worker in Russia, earning good money and sending some of it back to his parents each month to help with their living expenses.  

Ramazon also raises livestock for a living, selling their meat and milk at a local market.  For 2 years already, he has been using Arvand to secure loans for his business.  Now, once again, he is requesting a loan to buy livestock, and would like to thank Arvand in advance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: purchase livestock

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn, aged 32, lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district and has two children, both of whom are dependent and still too young for school. She and her husband are farmers and sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for three years. The current business earns about KHR 40,000 per day to support her family.  

This is the micro loan for Chanthorn's group of four members and she is the third cycled client. The past two loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now requesting a loan, Chanthorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan will help to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Maybelyn

texts.en:
Maybelyn is 44 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maybelyn has a buying and selling rice business in the Philippines. Maybelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries in her rice mill.

Maybelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Maybelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for rice grains and laborers' salaries in her rice mill.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Nat is 60 years old and widowed. She and her husband had seven children. She earns a living through farming rice and she has been in this business for almost ten years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately KHR 70,000 per day to support her family. 

This is the second loan for Nat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Nat is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 43 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Roselyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and providing motorcycle transportation. Lorna is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Rosalie has been raising pigs for 16 years now, and has borrowed 34 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha, 46, lives in a rural area of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province and she is single. The family’s main source of income is from rice farming. Having been in this business for more than 20 years, she earns about KHR 45,000 per day and can save about KHR 24,000 each day after expenses. 

Tha has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped relieve her family burden and improve her likelihood. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Tha will use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor and land ploughing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Khorn is aged 39 and widowed. She lives in a rural village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province and she has four children, all of whom are dependents as two are in school while the other two are too young for school. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for several years, earning about KHR 41,000 per day. 

This is Khorn's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and increase her income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Joesela

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Joesela works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling vinegar in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Joesela is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers for the storage of her vinegar.

Joesela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional containers for vinegar storage

loans.name: Ildirim

texts.en:
İldirim is 54 years old and lives with his wife and son. They live in Mahmudlu village of Füzuli. His daughter is married and lives away from them. His son is a taxi driver in the same village. For 20 years they have been IDPs (internally displaced people) from Füzuli city.

İldırım has been engaged in sheep-breeding at their homestead for many years. İldırım and his wife prepare dairy products (milk, cheese and yogurt) and he sells these products in the local bazaar to earn money. Also, he periodically sells sheep wool. 

Today İldırım needs AZN 1,500 and for this reason, he applied to Komak for a loan. He is planning for winter and wants to buy enough hay for the sheep and vaccinations for them.

He is thankful to Kiva and Komak for help. In the future, he wants to help for his son buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy enough hay and vaccinations for sheep

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old, married and has six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a business selling firewood in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood stock to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood stock to sell.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 67 years old, married and has eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessa has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Jessa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as body lotion, perfume and other personal products.

Jessa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jessa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as body lotion, perfume and other personal products.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Kheang is 54 years old and lives in a rural village in the Orng Snoul district, Cambodia. Of her six children, she still has two dependent sons to take care of. To support her family, she and her husband farm rice and work for others for fees and they have been in this business for six years. The current business earns them about KHR 60,000 per day to support her family. 

Kheang is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund. She completely paid back her previous loans, which has helped relieve her family’s burden. Now she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s tuition fees to study Korean Language. She hopes that this loan will provide financial support for her son, so he can focus on studying and obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees to study Korean Language

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 70 years old and widowed with one child.

Soledad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Soledad has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Soledad aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and married with three children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marites has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 42 years old, married with 2 children and both of her children are in school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a rural village in the Sa Ang district. She has been growing various kinds of vegetables for about nine years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about KHR 10,000 and she is able to save KHR 3,000 each day.
 
This is the first loan for Channy’s group of four members who live in the same village. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for family use.

loans.use: to build a latrine for family use

loans.name: Thong's Group

texts.en:
Thong, aged 61, lives in a rural village in the Sa Ang district and has two children. He and his wife are farmers who grow rice and vegetables in their village. He has been in this business for 41 years. The current business earns him about KHR 12,000 per day to meet his family’s needs. 

This is a micro loan for Thong’s group of three members and this is his first loan cycle. Now requesting a loan, Thong, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy a proper latrine. He hopes this loan will provide a decent latrine for his family.

loans.use: to buy a proper latrine

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
Sarah Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more charcoal stock to sell to customers.

Sarah Jean has been in this business for five years. Sarah Jean also earns income from food vending.

Sarah Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal stock to sell.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Thy, 41, has four children in total. Two of them are staying with the family and some are still in school. Thy and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming rice and growing vegetables for almost 20 years to make a living. The current business earns them about KHR 11,000 per day to support their family.
 
This is Thy's first loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Thy will use her portion to construct a decent latrine for her family to use. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine for her family to use

loans.name: Lucidy

texts.en:
Lucidy is 43 years old and married with six children.

Lucidy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery stock to sell.

Lucidy has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from clothing sales and selling charcoal.

Lucidy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years old married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Regina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Regina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Regina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Coming from a family that owned a grocery store business in the Dominican Republic, Rafael has always had a passion for business. A proud immigrant and American citizen, Rafael started La Suprema Meat Market this past June, after having successfully run a number of other grocery store enterprises.  

La Suprema stands out for its cleanliness, courtesy and service, and it offers a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables.  Rafael believes this winning model will lead to La Suprema’s success in West New York. He will use this loan to help stock up on inventory, as well as to promote flyers and specials to the community.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and flyers for marketing family-owned grocery store

loans.name: Sheldon

texts.en:
After nine years of business in the window cleaning industry, Sheldon visited Accion Texas Inc. for a business loan to expand his company by hiring two part-time employees, purchasing new equipment, and obtaining working capital.

Sheldon says the expansion of his business will allow for more work opportunities. Through his franchised business, Sheldon perfects residential and commercial windows up to three storeys tall. A natural salesman, Sheldon has been in business for almost a decade thanks to customer referrals and his ability to sell his services door-to-door.

As a franchised owner of the Fish Window Cleaning business, Sheldon is part of the world’s largest window cleaning company which began in January 1978.

As an entrepreneur, he is responsible for the success of his business, Sheldon offers consistent high-quality service in conjunction with his knowledge of taking windows from smudged to unblemished. See everything his business offers here: http://www.fishwindowcleaning.com/.

loans.use: to hire two part-time employees, purchase new equipment, and obtain working capital.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakame has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocery in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling used clothing and from a pig fattening business. Gloria is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business

loans.name: Saccat

texts.en:
Seccat is 39 years old. He has been in the butcher business for four years. He is married and has two sons. They are 13 and 14 years old. They go to school and show great interest in sports.

Seccat and his family are IDP ( internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city.

Seccat applied to Komak for a loan. He needs 1700 AZN. He has a small butcher shop in Bahmanlı village of Fuzuli region. He  buys cattle and sheep, then sells their meat in his local region and earns money. But he doesn’t have a fridge. For this reason, it is impossible to keep products fresh for a long time. He wants to buy a fridge to earn more money.

Seccat is thankful to Komak and Kiva for help to grow his business. In the future he wants to be medium-sized businessman and he wants to sell his own products in the surrounding region, too.

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Lucenia

texts.en:
Lucenia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lucenia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Lucenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for eleven years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to their community. She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to their community.

loans.name: Zuleyxa

texts.en:
Zuleyxa is 56 years old. She has a big family and lives with her husband, son, his bride and two grandchildren. Zuleyxa’s 2 daughters are married. They have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Füzuli city for 20 years and now live in Ahmadbayli village in the Füzuli region. Her husband, Muxtar, is a shoemaker, her son, Nuraddin, is a taxi driver and his bride, Bahar, is a housewife and helps her mother-in-law in her business.

Zuleyxa has cows. She buy small cows, raising them and selling to a butcher to earn money. Today Zuleyxa wants to buy more cows to increase income. For this reason, she needs 2,000 AZN to increase her business.

Zuleyxa is thankful for this aid from Kiva and the Komak organization. She want to build big stalls for cows and increase her business in the future so her income will be better. Also she wants her son's bride to continue this work in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a male Ugandan aged 24 years, married to Aidah with two children aged three and one years. He is a mechanic and he also owns a spare parts business in a nearby trading center. He works 6 days a week and 9 hours daily.

He has been doing this work for two years since his parents could no longer afford to pay his school fees.

He approached UGAFODE for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more spare parts and he hopes to pay it back using the profits from the sale of spare parts.

Abdu dreams of of completing his residential house and educating his children. His main challenge is competition from strong and established spare parts dealers. He is an honest and hard-working young man.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to be used in repairing motorcycles

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a divorced woman with four school-going children.They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates in a cafe preparing various foods such as beans, flat bread and rice which she sells to her customers.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase food ingredients, wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her business

loans.name: Nasimi

texts.en:
A 36-year-old man, Nəsimi is a small businessman. He is married and he has a daughter and a son. His daughter is 12 years old and his son 10 years old. His daughter goes to 6th class, and his son goes to 4th class. His daughter, a talented girl, plays the violin beautifully. She wants to continue her musical education and his son want to be a computer engineer. Therefore, in the future, Nəsimi wants to have a larger store, expand his business and wants to earn more money.

Now he has a small store where he sells food products and other necessary products for households. Previously he took a loan from Kiva. Now he wants increase the area of his store. After the help, he will increase the area of his store and start to sell cleaning products.

For this reason he needs 750 AZN. Nasimi is thankful to Komak for the loan. He is confident that this aid will help him to increase his business, earn more money and will ensure a bright future for his children.

loans.use: to  increase the area of his small store

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 41 years old, married and has nine children. Three of her children are in school.

Josie is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Josie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Josie has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from laundry. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 49 years old, married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, Merlinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Merlinda, who has been in this business for 15 years, would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 60 years old, married and has nine children. Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, shampoo and other groceries. 

Violeta requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Violate would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. 

Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married and has five children. One is in school and four are adults. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has practiced farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, a widowed mother of seven children, lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, Aida has operated a fruit and vegetable business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocers. 

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business, Aida has requested this loan to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a single woman with five school going children. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwari has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors and dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from her loan she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Kiva's partner organisation Yehu in order to gain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda is a married woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children. Two go to school and one is underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past year. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Crecensia

texts.en:
Crecensia is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married and a mother of one child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the last four years, selling household consumables. She cites price fluctuation as her major challenge.

With the loan of KES 30,000 she wants to purchase rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and soap for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with one school-going child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a business of selling leso cloth (women's wrap clothing). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase 20 pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of leso (women's wrap clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, a 41-year-old mother of six children, is a local citizen from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. For the sake of her family, she can earn a decent income via rice farming and selling grocery items. 

This will be Chreb's second microloan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Her past loan, which she has fully repaid, enabled her to offer timely support for the needs of her family. Chreb and her co-borrower are now seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees. 

Chreb hopes to gain an increased yield in order to earn more income, a portion of which she will set aside for her old age.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Mara

texts.en: Residing in Banteay Meanchey province, Mara is 46 years old and the father of four children. The main source of income for his family are his occupation as a construction manager and his wife’s job of working for others for a fee. This is the first loan for Mara with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend this entire loan portion on his son’s school fees and study materials. He hopes that his son can fulfill his dream of holding a bachelor's degree specializing in engineering and get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s school fees and study materials.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict

loans.name: Yok's Group

texts.en: Yok, 62, is the breadwinner in a family consisting of her and three children. Currently, she solely counts on a single business, selling groceries, as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. Yok’s past loan was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has succeeded in utilized her past loan to support her business as well as her living conditions. Finally, she has managed to repay the loan completely. Now, she is teaming up with a partner to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes to gain a good income from this business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está casada con Manuel y tiene 3 hijos de 19,17 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa que construyeron con sus esfuerzos. Zoila se dedica a la confección, lleva 10 años en esta actividad. Iniciándose con una máquina y en la actualidad cuenta con más de 6 máquinas de coser para diferentes acabados brindando trabajos bien realizados a sus clientes que salen satisfechos y la recomiendan con otras personas. También vende ropas que compra en la capital o que ella elabora, teniendo en su negocio un espacio donde exhibe sus productos.Estas actividades las realiza desde su casa, a donde llegan sus clientes y los atiende amablemente.Decidió a empezar con su actividad  ya que dejo su empleo y necesitaba de un oficio para generase sus ingresos económicos, además de la solicitud de sus vecinas al ver sus buenos acabados en la costura. Pero ya por edad le resulta algo cansado estar en una misma postura para coser, por eso con las ganancias desea invertir en una bodega de abarrotes. Este será el préstamo número 06 con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos y otros.
texts.en: Zoila is 52 years old and a hard-working and persevering woman.  She is married to Manuel, and has three children, aged 19, 17, and 5 years old respectively.  The family lives comfortably in their own house that, through their efforts, they were able to build.  Zoila makes a living in dressmaking.  Having started with just one sewing machine, Zoila has been doing this work for ten years and now has six different sewing machines in order to give a different finish to the clothes she makes.  The good work she produces means that her customers leave satisfied and recommend her to other people.  Zoila also buys clothes in Lima that she then sells, as well as selling the items that she makes.  Zoila runs her business in a small space where she can display her products.  She runs the business out of her home, where her customers come and Zoila treats them with a friendly manner.  Zoila decided to start his work as she left her job and needed a trade in order to earn an income.  Her neighbours wanted her to do this work when they saw the good-quality clothing that Zoila produces.  However, due to her age, Zoila is now physically tired of being in the same position all day to sew.  As a result, she would like to use her profits to start a grocery store.  This will be Zoila's sixth loan with Kiva.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her objectives.  Zoila promises to be punctual as she pays off her loans.  With this loan of 1200 Nuevo Soles, she will invest in buying sewing materials, such as material, threads, elastic, and more.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as material, threads, elastic, and more.

loans.name: Maritza Bernarda

texts.es: Maritza Bernarda mayor de edad soltera con tres  hijos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona que se caracteriza por ser comercial y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una pequeña pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como: granos básicos, productos congelados, detergentes sardinas, golosinas, gaseosas, huevos, sanicos entre otros, es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir mas en su pulperia en la compra de productos de consumo, productos congelados, entre otros, uno de sus sueños es poder algun dia ver terminada su casa y el de expandir y surtir su pulperia. Maritza agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Maritza Bernarda is single and has three adult children.  Originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, a commercial area with one of the biggest steel works in the country, Maritza has a small grocery store in her house where she sells different consumable products for the house.  She sells items such as basic grains, frozen goods, detergents, sardines, sweets, fizzy drinks, eggs, and more.  Maritza is hard-working and has a big desire to do better. One objective for this loan is to invest more in her grocery store.  She will buy consumable products, such as frozen goods.  One of Maritza's dreams is to, one day, see her house finished and to expand and stock up her grocery store.  Martiza thanks Kiva investors for helping those of scarce resources and for helping poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to give people a decent job.

loans.use: to buy consumable products for the home, such as frozen foods, fizzy drinks, and more.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además es muy atenta y amable con las personas. Está divorciada del padre de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Vive en su propia casa. Kelly se dedica a la venta de ropa, de buena calidad y modelos varados que están a la moda, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Todos estos productos son adquiridos en sus viajes a la capital y los vende desde la casa de su sobrina, ofreciendo también a sus vecinas y amistades a quienes trata de manera amable y cordial, ganándose sus preferencias y estos la recomiendan con otras personas. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y le sirven para solventar su gastos y la educación de su hijo. Se decido a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos ya que le faltaba para cubrir sus necesidades. Este será su sexto préstamo con Kiva por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, nos comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene  brindando a las personas que lo necesitan. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará ropa variada, y golosinas para vender en su casa. Buscará precios cómodos y así aumentar el margen de sus ganancias.
texts.en: Forty-six-year-old Kelly is hard-working and determined, and is very attentive and friendly with others.  Kelly is divorced from the father of her now adult and independent children. Kelly lives in her own house.  She makes a living selling good-quality clothes.  She offers different kinds of items which are in fashion for men, women, and children.  She buys all the products when she travels to Lima and then sells them out of her niece's house.  She sells to neighbours and friends, who prefer to buy from Kelly as she treats them in a polite and friendly manner.  Her customers recommend her to their friends.  Kelly believes that her business is profitable, given the income she earns from it.  Her profits allow her to cover her costs and to pay for her son's education.  Kelly decided to start this business because she needed an income to cover her household costs - before she did not have enough to pay for necessities.  This will be Kelly's sixth loan with Kiva and so she hopes to have Kiva lenders' support to continue working towards her objectives.  Kelly tells us that she likes the communal bank's work because of the support that it provides, helping those who need it.  With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles Kelly will buy a variety of clothes, and sweets to sell in her house.  Kelly will look for good prices and so increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk, and sweets.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to save money from her fruits and vegetables stall business. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase potatoes, onions and fruits for her business.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Syokwaa

texts.en:
Syokwaa is a single woman with three school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past 20 years, selling women's, men's and children's clothes. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a married and has eight children; two are in school and the rest are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the last ten years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a married woman who has been blessed with five school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Annastacia has operated a charcoal selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. Besides the charcoal business, she operates a hotel business preparing various food such as rice, tea, and beans.

She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase charcoal to resell. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to resell.
